title: Western Nations Offer New Plan On Namibia to South Africans
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2  The United States and four other Western nations presented a revised plan to South Africa last night that they hope will lead to a breakthrough in the drawnout negotiations for bringing independence to SouthWest Africa.

title: Private Lives
description: IT was no longer possible to pretend that there was anything left of summer. He was no longer able to imagine, as he sat in his garden, that he was really on the upper deck of an ocean liner, steaming eastward, as S.J. Perelman once put it, on the S.S. Leviathan, which was conveniently steaming in the same direction. Not only was the temperature dropping, but so were the caterpillars.

title: Cornfeld Is Backed By Banker
description: GENEVA, Oct. 2  Paul Vincent, former head of the Banque Rothschild of Paris, told a court here today that in May 1970, when Bernard Cornfeld relinquished control of Investors Overseas Service Ltd., it was still possible to rescue the nowdisintegrated financial conglomerate.

title: Cancer Agency Head Advises Diet Changes
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2  The director of the National Cancer Institute, citing incomplete evidence linking diet to cancer, advised Americans today to eat less fat, drink less alcohol, eat more fiber and avoid being overweight to reduce their risk of the disease.

title: A Home Cookbook Library on Microfilm
description: Within a short time, cookbooks are likely to become as obsolete as hoopskirts, bloomers, electric blenders and spats. I have seen the future  as a matter of fact it is on the desk next to my typewriter  and it is called CuisineVu.

title: Status of Hughes Bid
description: The Hughes Tool Company said yesterday that a responsible member of the Federal Trade Commission had told the company that the F.T.C. was not planning at present to block or delay Hughes Tool's tender offer for Oil Base Inc. The company noted that the agency had not closed its investigation of the offer.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, Oct. 2, 1979

title: 7 Turks Killed in Feuds
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct 2 (Reuters) Seven people have been killed in three incidents apparently arising from family feuds near the southeastern town of Urfa, the Turkish News Agency reported today. Four of them died in a gunfight between two rival families last night.

title: Fantasy Game Finds Unimagined Success
description: WASHINGTON Some think it is because there are no winners or losers in these games Others emphasize the opportunity to use one's imagination. Still others find a rejection of the kind of traditional competitiveness fostered by such games as Monopoly to be the reason for the popularity of fantasy games.

title: Personal Health
description: IF there ever was a Janusfaced phenomenon, it's alcohol. It eases tension and smooths social interactions, but blurs judgment and muddles reason. It's a nutrient that supplies 10 to 20 percent of the calories consumed by American adults, but it's also an antinutrient that Jeopardizes the body's supply of essential vitamins and minerals. heightens the desire for sexual activity at the same time that it hampers sexual performance.

title: Obituary 9  No Title
description: deaths

title: 3 Tremors Strike Central Italy
description: NORCIA, Italy, Oct. 2 (AP)  Three moderate tremors struck large areas of central Italy overnight, causing scattered panic but no injury or significant damage, authorities reported today. The Umbria region of central Italy was struck by a strong earthquake Sept. 18, which caused six deaths and left more than 4,000 people homeless.

title: 23.8% of 81.3 Million Employees Said to Belong to Labor Unions
description: Labor unions in 1977 represented 21.5 million workers, or 26.5 percent of the 81.3 million people employed in industry and government, according to a study by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor.

title: Economic Scene
description: GOLD markets all over the world are in a state of frenzy. Yesterday, gold peaked at $442 an ounce. The dollar, the world's key currency, in crisis. But in Belgrade, the finance ministers and central bankers of 138 countries are holding one of the most boring meetings in the history of the International Monetary Fund. This is as it should be. Boring is what finance officials try to be in the midst of a monetary crisis, and they are succeeding.

title: Off the Cuban Limb
description: If read carefully, President Carter's report to the nation on Soviet troops in Cuba says that there is no serious military problem and there may never have been one except in the minds of the President and some other American leaders. Translated loosely, this means there remains only a domestic political problem, from which Mr. Carter and the SALT II treaty must now be rescued.

title: Jesse Jackson Meets Sadat Again and Flies to See Assad and Arafat
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 2 (UPI) The Rev. Jesse L. Jackson flew here today from Cairo aboard President Anwar elSadat's jetliner and then set off for Damascus, Syria, in a car provided by the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Two Paris Shows  la Pollock
description: PARIS, Oct. 2  With a little gleam of patient irritation in her weathered eye, Lee Krasner recounted that the only question the French television interviewer wanted to ask about her late husband, Jackson Pollock, was whether he ever had selfdoubts or whether he considered himself the greatest American painter.

title: Year of Sweaters Comeback
description: After languishing in the background for the last three years while blouses stole the spotlight, sweaters are back. fact, the whole spectrum of knitted apparel  from twopiece knitted dresses to sweaterjackets and handknitshas returned with such a fashion vengeance that buyers have crowded the showrooms of both domestic and overseas manufacturers in numbers unseen since the early 1970's.

title: Market Place
description: RSING fuel prices, which have caused many American motorists this year to worry more and drive less, have hit the airlines, too. As a result, Wall Street analysts have been reducing their earnings estimates for the airlines. Nevertheless, they tend to remain relatively optimistic about prospects for the group, which typically shows wideprofit swings. Edmund Greenslet of Merrill Lynch, for example, had for some time been expecting the airlines to show lower earnings for the three months ended in September.

title: COMMODITIES Gold and Silver Gyrate In Wild Futures Trading
description: In one of the wildest trading sessions in Commodity Exchange history, gold and silver futures prices smashed back and forth between their permissible limits yesterday before closing with moderate losses and gains.

title: Big Board Seat Price Off
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that a seat was sold yesterday for $155,000, down $20,000 from the last sale on Sept. 28. Seats are now quoted at $150,000 bid and $175,000 offered.

title: Brown Gets Offer For Paper Mill
description: PASADENA, Calif., Oct. 3(AP)The Brown Company, a producer of paper and building products that is 80 percent owned by Gulf and Western Industries, said today that it had received an offer from the James River Corporation. a Virginia concern, for the assets of its Berlin, N.H., pulp and papermill, including 600,000 acres of woodlands.

title: Today's Itinerary in Philadelphia, Des Moines and Chicago
description: A 7:30 A.M. The Pope visits the Church of St. Peter and Tomb of St. John Neumann.

title: Loss Is Expected By Lukens Steel
description: The Lukens Steel Company said yesterday that it expected a loss from its operations during the third quarter, primarily because a flood disrupted production at its plate mill for five weeks and delayed shipments.

title: Belgian Rate Goes Up
description: BRUSSELS, Oct. 3 (AP)  Belgium's central bank today raised the discount rate, at which it lends to private banks, by one percentage point to 10 percent. It is the fifth increase since late May.

title: Owners of Recalled Fiats Assail Concern at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  Sixteen owners of 197071 Fiat Spyder 850 sports cars told the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration today that the automobile manufacturer's voluntary recall of the car was a joke because of low repurchase prices and that many unsafe vehicles would therefore remain on the roads.

title: Events Today
description: THE ALL NIGHT STRUTI musical conceived, directed and choreographed by Fran Charnas, Theater Four, 424 West 55th Street, 7.

title: Love Canal Residents Lose Bid for Damages
description: BUFFALO, Oct. 3 (AP) A State Supreme Court justice today rejected a $2.5 billion classaction claim filed on behalf of about 900 residents and former residents of the old Love Canal chemical dump site neighborhood in Niagara Falls.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: REIN DATE Jerzy Kosinski happens to be an avid horseman. His latest book, Passion Play, is not about the Oberammergau pageant but a professional polo player who travels across America as a game contestant.

title: Albany Panel Votes the Censure Of 6 Justices Over Ticket Fixing
description: ALBANY, Oct. 3 (AP)  The State Commission on Judicial Conduct has found that six more town and village justices should be censured for ticket fixing.

title: Maker of Homespun Music
description: In the 1930's, Roy Harris was considered one of the Big Five of American music. The others were Aaron Copland, Walter Piston, William Schuman and Samuel Barber. These five composers were going to lead American music intoa great era that would challlenge the dominance of Europe.

title: Bellamy, ExN.B.A. Star, Arrested in Camera Case
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 3 (AP)  Walt Bellamy, a former star in the National Basketball Association, was arrested last night and charged with possession of a stolen camera, the Atlanta police reported today.

title: Vietnamese, the Struggling or Secure, Are Flocking to California for Refuge
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 3 In a comfortable new subdivision on the outskirts of Los Angeles, living the life many Americans aspire to, dwells the Vietnamese Lee family  father. mother. three children.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Oct. 3 (UPI)  A bomb exploded on a passenger train near the southern city of Khorramshahr today, killing five persons and injuring at least 16, Iran's Pars news agency reported.

title: Judge Says Detroit Plan For Police Dept. Is Legal
description: DETROIT, Oct. 3 (AP)  A Federal judge has ruled that the Detroit Police Department's affirmative action program is legal and necessary because undoes years of discrimination and serves vital city needs.

title: 10,854 Refugees Leave Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 3 (Reuters)  Nearly 11,000 Indochinese refugees left Thailand for new homes abroad last month, a record monthly figure, officials of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees said today. The figure of 10,854 was nearly 3,000 more than the goal the United Nations group set after the Geneva conference on Indochinese refugees in July. A record 5,890 went to the United States.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: U.S. Said to Lag on a Mobile Force For Use in BrushFire Situations
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  Although President Carter has reaffirmed the importance of the Administration's program for creating a quickreaction military strike force for use in foreign crises, Government officials report that little has been done to organize such a unit.

title: Judge Dismisses Suit To Bar Mass on Mall
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  A Federal judge refused today to block mass by Pope John Paul II on the Governmentowned Mall next Sunday, rejecting an atheist's contention that the ceremony would violate First Amendment provisions for separation of church and state.

title: 19,000 Young People Cheer A Playful Pontiff at Garden
description: After a roaring, singing, brassband welcome for Pope John Paul II by almost 19,000 teenagers in Madison Square Garden yesterday, it was time for him to respond. The crowd came to a hush and the Pope, seated, leaned toward his microphone.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Thruway Gas Rules Removed
description: ALBANY, Oct. 3 (AP)  Restrictions on the maximum purchase of gasoline have been removed at all 30 service stations on the New York State Thruway between New York City and the Pennsylvania border west of Buffalo. A Thruway Authority spokesman said yesterday that the $10 limit that had been in effect at seven Atlantic Richfield Company stations west of Rochester was lifted on Monday.

title: Design Notebook
description: IN case you hadn't noticed, this year is the Centennial of Light. That little switch you flip so casually is being celebrated officially by the Smithsonian Institution. Amajor exhibition called Edison: Lighting a Revolution will open next Wednesday at the National Museum of History and Technology in Washington, dedicated to the 100th anniversary of Thomas Alva Edison's great invention, the incandescent electric light bulb. The show will remain on permanent display. Chalk up one more fascinating chapter in the Smithsonian's annals of art, science and nostalgia.

title: Home Beat
description: HE was a sculptor long before he was a furniture maker. Now his crafts are intermingled and hard to distinguish from each other. He was born in Sicily and educated by carpenters, and later went to Milan to study art and work as a cabinetmaker. Now Pino Pedano is having his first show outside Europe. His craft ineludes the lamination, collage and assembly of wood, including French pine, cypress, pitch pine, olive, ebony, rosewood, sandalwood and Douglas fir from the United States, Africa, Finland, France, Japan and Brazil. He thinks of his work more of a research into space than in form. Starting with a small sphere, he moved on to the pyramid, then the beehiveshape, then the flat panel and then the egg. Always he looked for the graphic possibilities in the material, leaving the natural markings in, working the knots and holes into the finished work. His tables, called millefogli, or a thousand leaves, are of laminated wood, glued and polished. This is a plastic art, Mr. Pedano said. Tactility is one of the wood's most important features. Wanting to touch a piece is to understand it. Starting tomorrow, Abitare, 212 East 57th Street, will display 11 tables (from $1,200 to $4,600), and 85 sculptural pieces (from $100 to $25,000). The pieces range from a smooth, paperweightsized domeshaped object to a multitude of boxes, larger architectural panels and tall pyramids.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: In a day of credit market records, the Treasury sold twoyear notes yesterday at a yield of 10.21 percent, their highest rate of return in modern times. Bell System corporate bond yields climbed to 10.20 percent, also a new high.

title: U.S. SEEKS REVERSAL OF VETERAN'S AWARD
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  In 1968, William A. Kubrick, a partly disabled Korean War veteran, left a Veterans Administration hospital after treatment for a bone infection in his leg and began to lose his hearing. Within a year he was nearly totally deaf. He sued the Federal Government for malpractice in 1972 and won a $320,000 Judgment.

title: U.S. Panel. in Reversal. Grants Parole to Addonizio After a 2Year Fight
description: TRENTON, Oct. 2  The United States Parole Commission today abandoned its twoyear fight to return former Newark Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio to Federal prison and granted him a parole.

title: The City
description: An 18yearold medical technician was arrested and charged in the $3,000 robbery at a Citibank branch on July 27, according to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. It said Michael Brown was seized at his home at 15510 116th Road in Jamaica, Queens, and was accused of having driven the getaway car.

title: Safeway's Profit Rose in Quarter
description: Safeway Stores Inc., the nation's largest supermarket chain, operating primarily west of the Mississippi, reported yesterday that it had profit increases of 30.3 percent in the third quarter ended Sept. 8 and 8.9 percent for the ninemonth period.

title: Top Meets Deserting. Van Cortlandt Park
description: Van Cortlandt Park, once the standard by which crosscountry courses were measured, is losing its championship credibility because of poor racing conditions.

title: Big Board Plans Commodity Role
description: In a step to reduce overlapping regulation in the securities industry, the New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it would assume responsibility for surveillance of the commodities accounts of its members.

title: A Suspect in Threat To the Pope Is Freed
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Oct. 3 (AP)  A native of El Salvador wanted for questioning in connection with a letter that said Pope John Paul II would be shot in New York was questioned in San Salvador and released today, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

title: Perils of the Pay Board
description: The old wageprice guidelines are now clearly in tatters. If the wage settlement between General Motors and the United Auto Workers is a sign of things to come, wages are going to push an already high inflation rate even higher.

title: In Philadelphia, Pope Condemns Sexual Laxity
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 3  Pope John Paul II was welcomed by exuberant crowds here this afternoon and, in a mass attended by hundreds of thousands of people at Logan Circle, emphasized basic human freedoms while warning against laxity regarding the Christian view on sexuality.

title: POPE, IN FAREWELL, TELLS NEW YORKERS A CITY NEEDS A SOUL
description: Shifting in delight from the role of world statesman to that of attentive shepherd, Pope John Paul II bade a warm farewell to New York yesterday by sharing laughter and affection with its citizens. Before departing for Philadelphia,the next stop on his weeklong national tour, the Pope turned a raindrenched packed house at Shea Stadium into an exuberant parish gathering.

title: Bertolucci: He's Not Afraid to Be Shocking
description: BERNARDO BERTOLUCCI was nervous. His latest film, Luna, was opening the New York Film Festival that evening, and he was wondering how the audience would react to his graphic story of incest between mother and son.

title: Obituary 6  No Title
description: Beatha

title: Pirates Subdue Reds, 32, in 10th And Assume 20 Lead in Playoff
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 3  The Pittsburgh Pirates, who have been trying to win a playoff from the Cincinnati Reds for 10 years, moved within one game of sweeping their way to the National League pennant today when they beat the Reds in extra innings for the second straight time.

title: Advertising by British Lawyers Gets Endorsement of Royal Panel
description: LONDON, Oct. 3  Lawyers in Britain should be given broad powers to advertise their services and fees, a royal commission said today in reporting on its exhaustive threeandahalfyear study of the country's muchcriticized legal system.

title: ESSAY Louder Than Words
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  President Carter may have unwittingly overreacted this week to the combat brigade placed in Cuba by the Soviets during his Administration.

title: Cardinal Is Old Friend of Pope
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 3  John Cardinal Krol, the sometimes controversial 68yearold Archbishop of Philadelphia, has acquired in his 18 years of ecclesiastical command here a reputation as a fairminded defender of traditionalism. cardinai Krol, me first American cardinal of Polish descent, is an old friend of Pope John Paul II. The Cardinal spent three weeks last June traveling with the Pontiff in Poland, and today when the Pope arrived the two embraced and stood together waving to schoolchildren. Indeed, Cardinal Krol may have put together the swing vote in Rome that put the relatively obscure Archbishop of Cracow, Karol Cardinal Wojtyla, into the Papacy.

title: Rooms as Varied As Their Occupants
description: THE spookiest thing about Charles Addams's room at Lord & Taylor is the stuffed mink. And the mink, reposing languorously on a 19thcentury Chinese pigskin chest, appears to be winking.

title: Arabs Skeptical of U.S. Promises on Dollar
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 3Each day, sometimes twice or three times a day, small groups of Arabs, wearing gold Rolex watches whose value in the past six months has nearly doubled, slip into a secondfloor suite of the Intercontinental Hotel here.

title: Attraction Of the Pope Is Unique
description: One way or another  from a seat in Yankee Stadium or Shea, a window high above a motorcade route, from a street corner or a church pew millions of Americans will at least catch a glimpse of Pope John H this week. As many more probably wish that they could, for reasons that are perhaps as varied as the crowds.

title: STUDY URGES U.S. AID TO CHINESE MILITARY
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  A Defense Department study has concluded that the United States should bolster China's military potential so that Peking could assist the West in a war with the Soviet Union.

title: Saudis, Stressing Regional Stability, See Soviet Threat
description: JIDDA, Saudi Arabia, Oct. 2  Senior Saudi officials here vow to intensify efforts to stabilize the Persian Gulf region and to persuade the United States to take a more forceful stand against what they see as Soviet ambitions to encircle the major oilproducing area.

title: TV: Stations Meet Test of Pope's Visit
description: THE extraordinary journey of Pope John Paul II has generated some extraordinary television coverage. In a chickenandegg dilemma, analysts will probably go on forever arguing about which came first, the expensive coverage or the stunning public response. One thing is certain: as the trip progresses, theemotional impact has accelerated to degree not anticipated by even the most fervent of bystanders.

description: Morning

title: A Better Idea The CatProof Fence
description: THE landscape designer Halsted Welles has designed a fence that will cheer both cat lovers and cat haters, but it will frustrate the cats. The fence looks a little like an upsidedown letter L; its prototype is installed in the garden of an Upper West Side town house for a client who tired of losing her cats over the back fence. I guessI got the idea from visiting the zoo and seeing the kind of barrier fencing they have there, Mr. Welles said. Once he had the idea, the execution was relatively easy because hardware for this shape fence was already manufactured for Cyclone fences that are topped with barbed wire. Mr. Welles used the galvanized poles to support stockade fencing and the angled brackets to support cedar slats instead of barbed wire. It's simple, but a bit expensive: about $30 per linear foot of sevenfoot stockade fencing topped with angled cedar slats.

title: Roy Harris, Prolific Composer of Americana, 81, Dies
description: Roy Harris,. one of the more prolific and more renowned of American composers, died on Monday in a hospital in Santa Monica, Calif., after a series of strokes. He was 81 years old. He had been composer in residence at California State University, Los Angeles, for 10 years and had been professor of music emeritus at the University of California at Los Angeles.

title: It's Official: Simms to Face Bucs; Piece of Meat?
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 3  The starting quarterback will be Phil Simms, Ray Perkins intoned today at the luncheon in the Giants pressbox lounge. I know that comes as a big surprise.

title: Technology
description: FEDERAL tax provisions concerning personal income earned abroad are casting a pall over the consulting engineering business, and with the United States ability to export heavy construction equipment and machinery.

title: New Avco President Due Oct. 26
description: Ross M. Hett, 47 years old, is expected to be elected president and chief operating officer of the Avco Corporation at its board meeting on Oct. 26, the company announced. He is to succeed George L. Hogeman, 62, who will become vice chairman. James R. Kerr, 62, remains chairman and chief executive officer.

title: PreorgasmicWomen: A Pattern Emerges
description: SHE describes herself as having been the kind of little girl who could wear a clean white dress, walk into a mud puddle and emerge absolutely spotless. She helped with the household chores, took care of little brother, did her homework every night and got good grades in school.

title: 21 Chiola Hanover Draws No. 10 Post for Futurity
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Oct. 3 (AP) Chiola Hanover fared poorly in the draw for starting position today but was nonetheless made the early 21 favorite for Friday's $100,000 Kentucky Futurity at the Red Mile. The Futurity,preceded by the Yonkers Trot and the Hambletonian, is the third leg of the triple crown for 3yearold trotters.

title: Man Arrested in Carter Threat
description: ST. LOUIS, Oct. 2 (AP)  A St. Louis County truck driver was arrested this morning by Secret Service agents in connection with a letter containing a threat to the life of President Carter, the authorities said. David E. Feuerstein, 40 years old, of Pine Lawn had allegedly sent the letter to Ted Welch, president of Teamsters Local 600 here. The letter reportedly said: The 600 union better kill Jimmy Carter. It they don't, I will. President Carter has to come to my chamber. It convicted, Mr. Feuerstein, faces a maximum penalty of five years in prison and a $1,000 fine.

title: U.S. INCREASES LIMIT ON GRAIN FOR SOVIET TO RECORD AMOUNT
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The Agriculture Department gave the Soviet Union permission today to buy a record 25 million metric tons of American corn and wheat during the coming 12 months.

title: Remarks at Madison Square Garden
description: Dear young people, I am happy to be with you in Madison Square Garden. Today, this is a garden of life, where young people are alive. Alive with hope and love. Alive with the life of Christ. And it is in the name of Christ that I greet each one of you today.

title: Transcript of Pontiff's Speech at Battery Park
description: Your Eminence, dear friends. My visit to your city would not have been complete without coming to Battery Park, without seeing Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty in the distance

title: Olivetti Chief a New Star in Italy
description: IVREA, Italy  Carlo de Benedetti, the 44yearold chief executive officer and controlling shareholder in Olivetti, the giant Italian officeequipment maker, is giving Giovanni Agnelli, the head of Fiat, a run for his money for the title of Italy's bestknown businessman.

title: Mondale Back From Panama
description: BALBOA, Panama, Oct. 3 (AP)  Vice President Mondale returned to Washington yesterday after taking a cruise on the Panama Canal and flying over the former Canal Zone in a helicopter. Mr. Mondale was in Panama to represent the United States at the ceremonies Monday marking the turnover of the area to Panama by the United States.

title: Stirring End to John Paul's Visit
description: The bells of Trinity Episcopal Church pealed joyously for the Pope yesterday and paper streamers, fluttering in the winddriven rain, wrapped themselves around its steeple. Shredded paper and computer printouts swirled from office windows, thatching the umbrellas of officeworkers who lined both sides of Broadway, as the motorcade of John Paul II made its way through the Wall Street area.

title: City Opera And Union Fail to Meet
description: The New York State Mediation Board announced yesterday that a joint meeting between the New York City Opera and its orchestra, scheduled for late yesterday afternoon, had been postponed indefinitely.

title: Coward, McCann Elevates Geoghegan
description: Coward, McCann & Geoghegan is making room at the top starting Jan. 1, with everybody getting promoted one notch and nobody scheduled to depart. The publisher is part of the Putnam Publishing Group, which includes G.P. Putnam's Sons.

title: Gifts Abound In Papal Visit
description: The gifts of New Yorkers to Pope John Paul II were as varied as their givers and the circumstances under which they were given.

title: Armi Ratia, Marimekko Founder And Innovator in Printed Fabrics
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Oct. 3 (UPI) Armi Ratia, the woman whose Marimeklco clothes and textiles helped make the Finnish design world famous, died today after a long illness. She was 67 years old.

title: Scott Loses Rating, Quits Ring
description: James Scott, once the No. 2ranked World Boxing Association light heavyweight, said yesterday he was quitting professional boxing because he had been barred from championship fights while in prison.

title: Resiliency of Pontiff Is Impressing Many
description: In the midst of a grueling schedule that will probably reach a crescendo today when he travels from Philadelphia to Des Moines to Chicago, Pope John Paul II is impressing many observers and colleagues with his powers of recuperation from strain.

title: Jackson Hospitalized in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Oct. 3 (AP)  The Rev. Jesse L. Jackson was hospitalized with a stomach ailment tonight and had to put off plans to call on Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader. So Mr. Arafat went to see him, giving the civil rights leader a kiss and a bouquet of flowers.

title: Sacramento Bishop Recovering After He Is Stabbed at Cathedral
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Oct. 3 (UPI)Bishop Alden Bell, the Roman Catholic leader of Sacramento, was stabbed twice today by a man wielding a knife. The 75yearold bishop, who had planned to fly to Chicago tomorrow to see Pope John Paul II, was listed in good condition at Mercy General Hospital.

title: Jersey Education Chief Proposes Tougher Standards for Students
description: TRENTON, Oct. 3  The State Education Commissioner, Fred G. Burke, recommended today a tightening of high school graduation requirements in New Jersey, beginning with the 198182 school year. By 1985, he said, high school students should be required to demonstrate a proficiency in certain required courses before being awarded high school diplomas. saying mat me time sociai promotions in high schools is drawing to a close, Mr. Burke said that he developed the plan in response to a growing demand in the State Legislature for tougher graduation requirements.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: UNTIL recently, mounting fabric on walls has been a complex job best left to professionals. FabriTrak has made it easier for the amateur to tackle the task. FabriTrak is a system that uses plastic track to hold fabric in place on a wall. The track is fitted around the perimeter of the walls, windows and doors and attached by nails, screws or glue. Selfadhering tape on the track holds the fabric in place while it is properly aligned. A special tool is then used to stuff the fabric into the track, where it is held in place by plastic jaws. The space between the wall and the fabric can be filled with batting ror soundproofing and warmth. The track comes in 4foot strips, which can be cut with a razor or saw. Each strip costs $4.50. The stuffing tool is $8; shims to bring sockets and switches out to the level of the fabric cost $4.50 each. The FabriTrak system is available at Fabrications, 146 East 56th Street.

description: JANE HOUSTON

description: ASKYJACKING thriller by Mary McCarthy? Well, yes: In Cannibals and Missionaries, Miss Mc Carthy's sixth novel and 17th book, an Air France B747 does get diverted at gunpoint from its destination at Teheran and is

title: At Shea, A Moving Goodbye
description: Pope John Paul II and New York City bade each other an emotional farewell at Shea Stadium yesterday, the Pontiff speaking fondly of the special qualities of the city in four of its tongues and thousands of its people replying with applause.

title: The Editorial Notebook What Mexico Remembers
description: A WellKnown AUK emperor was unmentioned last week when President Carter talked with President Lopez Portillo. Having learned one lesson about Mexican sensitivity, the Carter Administration seems about to absorb another  this time about oil.

title: Opera Orchestra Plans 3 Works in Concert Form
description: The Opera Orchestra of New York, founded and conducted by Eve Queler, will present three operas in concert form in Carnegie Hall.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ZURICH, Oct. 3 (AP)  Mexico has withdrawn from the qualifying tournament for the Olympic soccer championship, leaving the United States to advance into the following round, the International Federation of Football Associations announced today.

title: Transcript of Shea Stadium Farewell
description: Dear friends in New YorK: It gives me great joy to have the opportunity to come and greet you on my way to La Guardia Airport, at the end of my visit to the archdiocese and to the metropolis of New York.

title: Georgia Court Bars Mercy Plea For Slayer of Dr. King's Mother?? r??
description: ATLANTA, Oct. 3 (AP)  The Georgia Supreme Court today rejected an appeal by Marcus Wayne Chenault, who has been sentenced to death for the murder of the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s mother.

title: Crown Zellerbach
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct. 3 (AP)  Crown Zellerbach Canada Ltd. said today that it would expand newsprint operations at its Elk Falls, British Columbia, mill, following a decision by British Columbia Hydro and Power Authority to deliver more electric power to Vancouver Island.

title: W.B.L. Stars, Miss Meyers Unable to AEree to Terms
description: Ann Meyers, the first woman signed by a National Basketball Association team, will not become a member of the New York Stars of the Women's Basketball League, Edward Reisdorf, president of the Stars, said yesterday.

title: GARDENING
description: MY first year's venture at turning my lawn into a flowery meadow is completed now and I am calling it a qualified success. Instead of just grass I have had a stand of fivefoothigh evening primrose, some lesser celandine and daisy fleabane. But before going on, I should explainwhat I have been up to, which requires an explanation how I feel about lawns and cruelty to grass.

title: Rock: Abba, Swedish Quartet, in New York Debut
description: ONE way of looking at Abba, the Swedish rock quartet that sold out Radio City Music Hall in its New York debut Tuesday night, is that it has turned itself into a deliberate caricature of what the world thinks Swedish people must be  beautiful, blond and coldly perfect. Clearlythe world has responded to the group's records with glee: Abba makes the claim, however unsupported, of having sold more records than any other act in the history of music.

title: Another Mets Buyer Reported
description: John O. Pickett Jr., a business consultant who as chairman of the board has helped turn around the financial fortunes of the New York Islanders hockey team, has been negotiating seriously since June to buy controlling interest in the New York Mets, sources close to the baseball club reported yesterday.

title: Q&A
description: Q. We have a cement porch that sweats when the outside humidity is high. Water comes out of the concrete floor, preventing us from using it. We applied a sealer, but this made things worse. It left a gummy film on the surface that had to be removed with paint thinner. Do you know of any type sealer we could apply that would keep water from coming through this floor? M.G., Metairie, La.

title: ATOMIC DELAY LAID TO INFORMATION LAG
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The five members of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission said today that in the first day of the accident at the Three Mile Island reactor they would have at least considered the possibility of evacuating nearby residents had they been aware of all the information known to the commission staff and the utility operating the plant.

title: Pope, at Battery Park, Pays Homage to American Ideal
description: Framed by Ellis Island, the portal through which some 12 million immigrants entered America, and the Statue of Liberty Pope John Paul II today paid homage to the American ideal of freedom.

title: Film: Moliere Biography
description: THE first image of "Molire," Ariane Mnouchkine's very long French movie about the life and times of Jean-Baptiste Poquelin (1622-73), the dramatist known as Molire, is that of a tired serving woman making her way down a dim corridor. The image turns into what is virtually a sequence, which is the habit of this film that stretches things out without creating tension. The woman comes out of the corridor, crosses the empty arena of the theater and goes up a few steps. Then she walks down another dim corridor. The camera follows her expectantly, as if awaiting some revelation from a silent sigh or an imperceptible limp. It waits. We wait. Nothing. It just goes on.And on.And on.This is terrible way to begin a movie you know is to be 4 hours and 15 minutes long. If it's this empty when, so to speak, it's full, what's it going to be like by the time we reach the end? It's not giving away anything except a warning to reveal that it actually gets not only more boring, but even emptier.One of Miss Mnouchkine's other singular achievements is that she has managed to make such a gargantuan film without stumbling on one original or arresting scene. There's even very little biographical material of interest, and some of what it does contain is open to question. Was the Armande Bjart whom Molire married the younger sister of Madeleine Bjart, Molire's long-time mistress, as I'd always understood, or Madeleine's daughter, as the movie says? I'm asking, but I'm not really that interested.Miss Mnouchkine, who wrote and directed "Molire," her first solo credit, is known in Paris as a theater director. It shows. "Molire" is full of the sort of theatrical clichs associated with the once-thought radical theater of improvisation of the 60's. The movie, which covers Molire's life from age 10 until his death, means also to give us a picture of French life in cinematic methods that are sometimes Realistic, sometimes Impressionistic in the manner of failed Fellini.Molire himself, played by Philippe Caubre, remains an impassive figure, taking in, as we do, Miss Mnouchkine's endless succession of tableaux, especially processions and revelries in which the poor people of France always seem to have access to extraordinarily sophisticated costumes, including what look to be pressed plastic masks that the director is especially enamored of. The crowd scenes won't stop, but they don't contain people, only actors busily trying to imitate people by being too jolly or too outraged, or by clutching one another, like extras in an opera.In all of this we are given surprisingly little information about the 17th-century French theater. There seems to be more Corneille recited on stage than Molire, the intention apparently being to send up poor old Corneille. When Molire settles down to his acclaim and censorship problems in Paris, the movie breezes by his greatest plays with a montage of printed titles.History is represented by brief appearances by Louis XIV, Colbert and a speechless Richelieu. Miss Mnouchkine appears to have some thoughts about kingship-as-theater, but nothing to make us forget the austere power of Rossellini's "The Rise of Louis XIV."There's a hilarious scene in which Molire and his pals rush off to hear Descartes read from his works, but this Descartes is a letdown. He looks and sounds like that immortal Ernie Kovacs character, Percy Dovetonsils, the bad (and often sloshed) poet. The measure of the movie, though, is most truly revealed in an exchange that takes place near the end. La Grange, an actor in Molire's company, reports that "Georges Dandin" is not drawing well and that they need a new play. "Yes, I know," Molire says. "I've just started one, about a miser.""Molire" will be shown at the New York Film Festival in Alice Tully Hall today at 7 P.M. and Saturday at 12:30 P.M.

title: Rail Rate Increase Backed by Court
description: RICHMOND, Oct. 3 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission is not carrying out the intent of Congress to revitalize the nation's railroads, an appeals court said today in ordering the agency to reconsider its denial of rate increases for lumber and forest products.

title: T.V.A. Wins Second Fight Over a Dam in a Week
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Oct. 3 (AP)The Tennessee Valley Authority today got approval to complete its $140 million Columbia Dam, thus winning its second battle in a week against an endangered species.

title: Jones Fires Barbs at Colt Owner
description: He called himself merely a pawn in the big chess game, but Bert Jones also took the offensive yesterday in discussing his troubled Colts, who face the New York Jets on Sunday in Baltimore.

title: Excerpts From Homily At Mass in Philadelphia
description: Philadelphia is the city of the Declaration of Independence, that remarkable document, containing a solemn attestation of the equality of all human beings, endowed by their Creator with certain inalienable rights: life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, expressing a firm reliance on the protection of Divine Providence.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: SWERDLINGGloria of 302 W. 12 St., NYC, on Oct 2, 1979. Beloved daughter of Jessie Factor, loving sister of Burton Swerdling, Melvin Swerdling and Muriel Marcus. Funeral from The Suburban Chapel of Philip Apter & Son, 1600 Springfield Ave., Maplewood, NJ, on Fri., Oct 5, at 12 noon. Interment Beth Israel Cemetery, Woodbridge, NJ

title: Corporate Earnings
description: cates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Tornado Pummels 2 Towns Near Hartford, Killing One and Injuring 300
description: WINDSOR LOCKS, Conn., Oct. 3  A tornado swooped down out of a blackened sky this afternoon, killing one person, injuring more than 300, smashing homes and stores to splinters and tossing cars and tractortrailer trucks about like toys as it ravaged a fivemile stretch of State Highway 75, adjacent to Bradley International Airport.

title: Sound
description: DGITAL tuners are much in vogue among the fancier stereo gear, and possibly this has to do as much with the sound of the word as the sound of the equipment. The term digital, redolentof computers, seems imbued with a mystique that these days assures uncritical acceptance of almost anything so designated. Thus, digital tuning is generally understood to be a good thing, yet most audio fans have only a hazy notion of its whys and wherefores.

title: Tenneco Plugs Well
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 3 (Reuters)Tenneco Inc. said today that an exploratory well off New Jersey was being abandoned as a dry hole by its Tenneco Oil exploration unit. The company said it represented the first test of outer continental shelf acreage acquired last February in the second Federal lease sale for the Baltimore Canyon.

title: TAX BREAK IS VOTED FOR HOTEL RENEWAL
description: A city panel yesterday granted a 20year realestate tax abatement for the renovation and reopening of the Royal Manhattan Hotel on Eighth Avenue between 44th and 45th Streets. It turned down an abatement request by the Sotheby Parke Bernet auction house for an additional location in Manhattan on York Avenue at 72d Street.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Factory Orders Up 2% in Month
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  After two months of declines, new orders received by the nation's factories rose 2 percent in August to $142.7 billion, the Commerce Department reported today the rebound in new orders, following drops of 1.6 percent in July and ninetenths of 1 percent in June, was another indication that economic activity in the third quarter may have been stronger than was initially thought.

title: Making Sure the Family Piano Has a Long and Tuneful Life
description: WITH a dash of mohagany and a sprinkle of strings, Henry Engelhard Steinway cooked up the modern piano in his steamy German kitchen 143 years ago. Reminded of these moist beginnings, Mr. Steinway's greatgrandsons, who now build pianos in a climatecontrolled warehouse in LongIsland City, agreed that the kitchen was no place to build or to keep a piano. But since it was his first piano, the inventive cabinetmaker may be excused for subjecting it to climatic extremes,which will ultimately destroy the delicate instruments.

title: Around the Nation
description: CONCORD, N.H., Oct. 3 (UPI)  Gov. Hugh J. Gallen issued a warning today to antinuclear protesters who plan to take over the Seabrook nuclear power plant this weekend, saying, Be prepared to pay the price.

title: Bridge:
description: For almost 20 years, from 1957 until 1975, the Italian Blue Team dominated the world team championships, winning on almost every occasion it competed. Then the Italians ran into trouble.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: Gold prices fell in Europe by as much as $33.50 an ounce yesterday and even dropped below $400 an ounce in New York as nervous traders worried that the United States Government might take additional steps to defend the dollar.

title: Chile Attracts U.S. Business
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 3  While Chile's Supreme Court was refusing to extradite to the United States this week three army officers accused of planning a political assassination in Washington, Anaconda was signing a contract to invest up to $1.5 billion in a new copper mine here.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: THURSDAY, OCTOBER 4, 1979

title: Central African Students Unhappy With New President
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic This capital's students and teachers, an elite and potent force of several thousand who rose in protest against former Emperor Bokassa I in January and were quieted only with the aid of Zairian troops, are already unhappy with the new President, David Dacko, as well as with his top advisers, the French.

title: Fall Is the Best Time to Begin
description: THE natural or meadow lawn might seem like the lazy gar dener's way out of lawn care. Actually, It may:be the lawn of the future. Grown on sound ecological principles, not one drop or gaso line is needed for mowing because it's cut by hand with a scythe, once, maybe twice a year.

title: Home Improvement
description: HOMEOWNERS and apartment dwellers can make their own rigid storm windows for the inside or outside by using a recently introduced vinyl framing kit that can be assembled with ordinary window glass or clear acrylic plastic.

title: Coast Officials Report Exposure of Hundreds To Poisons in 3 Pools
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Oct. 3 (AP)Health officials, warned by a bizarre anonymous letter, said today that hundreds of people might have been exposed to a suspected cancercausing chemical deliberately dumped in three swimming pools.

title: Penney's Sales Up in September
description: The J.C. Penney Company told security analysts yesterday that its sales in September rose 2 percent from the yearearlier period, when the company reported a 17 percent increase over 1977. Volume in the five weeks ended Sept. 29 increased to $1.01 billion from $990 million.

title: 2 Get Death Penalty in Arkansas
description: MORRILTON, Ark., Oct. 3 (AP)Two men were sentenced today to die in the electric chair on June 3, 1980. Judge Charles Eddy of Conway County Circuit Court imposed the sentence on Paul Ruiz and Earl Van Denton after a recommendation by the jury. Yesterday, the same jury found the men guilty of capital murder in the 1977 slayings of Marvin Richie of Magazine and Opal James of Havana.

title: Colorful Area Bedecked With Photos and Flags
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 3  On the day the Pope came here to visit, Marie DiNubile arose before dawn, washed her front windows, step and sidewalk before her neighbors went to work, and gave a free loaf of bread to the first woman who entered her small store all of which she has done every morning for decades.

title: Orioles Win on Homer in 10th
description: BALTIMORE, Oct. 3  The California Angels first taste of postseason experience began sweetly tonight when Nolan Ryan struck out the first four Baltimore batters he faced, but it ended sourly when John Lowenstein cracked a pinchhit, twoout, threerun homer off John Montague in the 10th inning.

title: Audit Finds Large Quantities of Lunar Rocks Missing
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)  Substantial quantities of lunar rock samples brought back from the moon by the Apollo astronauts are missing, according to an internal audit by investigators for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: THURSDAY, OCTOBER 4, 1979

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, OCTOBER 4, 1979

title: Eisenhower Payers Cast New Light on Nixon in 1956
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 3 (AP)  Richard M. Nixon did not take the hint when President Eisenhower tried to ease him off the 1956 Republican ticket, according to a CarnegieMellon University professor who has seen the general's private papers.

title: Reynolds Raises Prices
description: The Reynolds Metals Company yesterday joined other major aluminum producers in raising the price of ingot, the industry's basic product, by 3 cents, to 66 cents a pound. The company also raised prices for other primary ingot products by 4 cents a pound.

title: Visitors to Pol Pot Border Camp In Cambodia Find Malnutrition
description: BAN LAEM, Thailand, Oct. 3 (AP) At the entrance to the camp, on the Cambodian side of the border, a young boy stood awaiting the visitors, his spindly limbs and distended belly testifying to malnutrition.

title: In the Matter Of Mein Kampf
description: A German antiquarian dealer in the provincial city of Firth recently purchased for resale two copies of Naziera printings of Adolf Hitler's Mein Kampf. Brought to trial by the public prosecutor, acting under a law that prohibits the dissemination of literature produced during the Nazi period, the dealer was found guilty, fined, and his two books were confiscated.

title: Patriots Johnson Sidelined
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Oct. 3 (AP) Andy Johnson, the New England Patriots veteran running back, was declared sidelined for the season today because of a left knee injury suffered in Green Bay Monday night. A club spokesmansaid that an orthoscope examination disclosed that Johnson has a torn medial collateral ligament in the knee.

title: Critic of Court System Brings About Mistrial
description: ALBANY, Oct. 3 (AP)  A remark by a potential juror, the applause of some fellow panelists and a sharp rebuke from the Judge led yesterday to a mistrial in Albany County Court.

title: Market Place
description: UNTIL recently, there were petroleum analysts in Wall Street who had never heard of the Belridge Oil Company of California. Thanks to a spirited bidding contest, however, littleknown Belridge has become a hot property  and a hot stock.

title: Britain Protests to U.S. On Oil Antimonopoly Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The British Government has lodged a protest with the State Department over the terms of legislation introduced by Senator Edward M. Kennedy that would limit the investment United States oil companies could make in foreign concerns.

title: Senator Tower of Texas to Head G.O.P. Platform Committee in 80
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (UPI)  Senator John G. Tower of Texas will head the 1980 Republican national convention platform committee, the party chairman, Bill Brock, announced today.

title: MICHIGAN OUTFLANKS HOSPITAL OPPONENTS
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Oct. 3  The University of Michigan applied some political muscle recently to win state approval for construction of what has been termed the country's costliest hospital in a fight that demonstrated some of the difficulties of holding down the rise in medical costs.

title: Deadline Extended At Rock Island
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 3 (AP) The Interstate Commerce Commission, acting just hours before a Federal deadline for the resumption of service on the strikebound Rock Island railroad, extended that deadline today by two days. The Kansas CityTerminal Railway Company was given until 12:01 a.m. Saturday to take over management of the Rock Island for 60 days.

title: Nonstop Talks Start in Bid to Settle Strike by L.I.U.'s Brooklyn Faculty
description: Negotiators for the Brooklyn Center of Long Island University and striking faculty members began nonstop talks yesterday in a new attempt to settle a thirdweekold strike that has caused the suspension of classes for 7,000 students.

title: Islanders Top Nordiques, 62
description: QUEBEC, Oct. 3 (AP)  Mike Bossy scored two goals as the New York Islanders came back from a 20 deficit to score a 62 triumph over the Quebec Nordiques in a National Hockey League preseason game tonight.

title: Prayers Answered In Unexpected Stop
description: For days there had been been the question whether Pope John Paul II could squeeze a stop in Brooklyn into his schedule. Yesterday the answer came.

title: Votes at Laborite Conference Shift Power Toward Left
description: BRIGHTON, England, Oct. 3  The Labor Party's annual conference voted today to deny the party leader any voice in the drafting of manifestoes, or electoral campaign platforms.

title: Charnin Delights in Recalling Annie's Birth Pangs
description: MARTIN CHARNIN was in the midst of training yet another group of seven little girls to act like orphans and one shaggy dog to act cute. I still think it's a lousy Idea, his friendThomas Meehan muttered halfseriously as he watched the goingson at rehearsal the other day of the third national company of Annie.

title: Poor Women and the Merciless House
description: In what is becoming an annual event, the Federal Government again has had to start a new fiscal year with its budget in limbo because the House insists on being pinched and stubborn about abortion.

title: Mrs. Kreps to Step Down As Commerce Secretary
description: Secretary of Commerce Juanita M. Kreps has submitted her resignation to President Carter and will be leaving his Cabinet at the end of this month, she said yesterday.

title: Mrs. King and Miss Austin Win to Gain Ouarterfinals
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Oct. 3 (AP)  Billie Jean King and Tracy Austin moved into the quarterfinals of the United States women's indoor tennis championships with straightset victories tonight at the Met Sports Center.

title: President Submits Plans For Protection of Rivers
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  President Carter sent to Congress yesterday a package of proposed legislation that is intended to protect rivers in 11 states. He also urged expansion of the nation's National Trails System.

title: Strict Sidewalk Cafe Law Backed
description: Tighter regulation of sidewalk cafes in New York City, proposed by the city's Planning Commission, received support yesterday from neighborhood groups and restaurant operators.

title: Scotto Trial Prosecutors Focus on Sports Car Purchase
description: Federal prosecutors presented testimony and tape recordings yesterday in an effort to show that Anthony M. Scotto had purchased a $28,485 sports car in a surreptitious manner to conceal cash from the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Priests Fill the Pews As Pope Holds Rites
description: Anyone could see that the Rev. Donald Hanson's forehead was damp with sweat, so Pope John Paul II did the only charitable thing and pulled out a handkerchief to mop the surprised priest's brow.

title: Letters
description: To THE HOME SECTION: In the special energy issue [Sept. 13], it was mentioned that one could have a turbulator installed in a boiler for about $20 (during cleaning and tuneup) and that it would save about $20 in heating costs the first month. My heating service has never heard of a turbulator, nor has its supplier. Is there another name or further descriptive detail vou could provide?

title: To Extinguish Burning Crosses
description: Stopping the wave of crossburnings on the lawns of black families in the New York area is the job of local law enforcement agencies. But there is room also for Federal law enforcement, both to deter such vicious vandalism and to encourage local agencies to act against it. So it is good that a United States Attorney has brought a Federal criminal case against a young crossburner in Ridgefield. Conn.

title: A FastActing Home Sprinkler System
description: WASHINGTON FEDERAL officials last week unveiled a fastacting sprinkler system for the home that they hope will be the key to their goal of cutting in half the loss of life and property in residential fires over the next 20 years.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 3, 1979

title: Art: Chicago Institute, 100 Years Old, Shows Lautrec
description: CHICAGO THIS year marks the 100th anniversary of the founding of one of the nation's great museums  the Art Institute of Chicago. To celebrate this historic occasion, the institute has mounted two splendid exhibitions  a big retrospective survey of the paintings of Henri de ToulouseLautrec (18651901), and an unusual show of 16thcentury Roman drawings from the collection of the Louvre. In the latter exhibition are capital examples of Michelangelo, Raphael and other Italian masters of the High Renaissance and Mannerist styles.

title: Care, Repair and Preservation of Books
description: WHEN we moved to smaller quarters recently, we were forced to box and store 125 books in a basement in a house near the sea. Worries aboutdampness and mildew made me seek advice on packing for longterm storage. A call to the New York Public Library put us in touch with Robert De Candido, head of the Physical Treatment Branch of the Conservation Division, and resulted in instructions that were transmitted to the movers.

title: About Hempstead
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.  The world is flat in this part of the Long Island plain, and this scientifically discredited impression seems a strange setting for the research into past and future that goes on in the Life Sciences Building at Hofstra University.

title: Photogenic Estate Of a Camera Pioneer
description: LACOCK, ENGLAND WITH its medieval abbey and Tudor cottages, framed by rolling green countryside, this village 100 miles west of London is as pretty as a picture. It is also, coincidentally, the home of William Henry Fox Talbot, generally credited as the father of modern photography. Many of FoxTalbot's pioneering photographs are now on display at the Pierpont Morgan Library in New York, providing a rare glimpse of early photographic experiments as well as of the village here and its abbey, Fox Talbot's ancestral home.

title: Jews and Protestants Laud Visit
description: A wave of praise from Protestant and Jewish leaders seems to be answering the question, raised by many church leaders before his visit began, of how Pope John Paul II's religious zeal would be received by nonCatholics in this highly pluralistic country.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: OAK BROOK, Ill., Oct. 3 (AP) Fairchild Industries Inc. has made a new offer to the Bunker Ramo Corporation, proposing to buy 1.7 million convertible preferred and common shares for f33 each, Bunker Ramo said today.

title: Jetliner in Emergency Landing
description: CHARLESTON, S.C., Oct. 3 (UPI) A Delta Airlines 727 jetliner with 69 passengers aboard made an emergency landing at Charleston International Airport last night because the cabin had lost pressure. One person was hospitalized. The aircraft, on the way from Orlando, Fla., to New York City, landed safely, the airline said.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Only 3 May Enter Gold Cup
description: The field for Saturday's $350,000 added Jockey Club Gold Cup at Belmont Park may develop into the smallest for this thoroughbred race in more than 30 years.

title: Notes on People
description: First, a bit on the roots of Alex Haley's house.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Alcan Aluminum Corporation, Cleveland, has named S. Bruce Heister president of its Alcan Cable division.

title: G.M. CarParts Plan Ruled to Be Illegal
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  The General Motors Corporation was found today to be illegally discriminating against independent body shops that compete against G.M. dealers for jobs repairing crashdamaged cars.

title: The Recycling of Gas Stations
description: THEY are real estate offices and swimming pool service centers in Austin, Tex; SevenEleven stores in Wyandotte, Mich.; a jewelry store in Philadelphia, and a Baptist church in Springfield, Mo. In Utah, one is an artist's studio, and in Venice, Calif., one is even home.

title: Macchiarola Says School Coaches Manipulated Students in Protests
description: Charging that high school students throughout New York City had been manipulated by their athletic coaches, School Chancellor Frank J. Macchiarola vowed yesterday that the protest would not work and that police action would be used to prevent further demonstrations during the school day.

title: Advertising
description: WHEN Thomas A. Murphy, chairman of the General Motors Corporation, decided that of his many ad agencies he'd ask N.W. Ayer ABH International to handle the volunteer effort for National Bible Week, did be remember that the agency's motto is Human contact?

title: MILTON GILBERT, 70; WAS FINANCE EXPERT
description: Dr. Milton Gilbert, an economist and former adviser to the Bank for International Settlements, an international clearinghouse for central banks of the world, died of a heart attack last Saturday in Washington. He was 70 years old.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Gold futures came under increased selling pressure yesterday after the major London bullion dealers slashed their second fixing by $24 an ounce from Tuesday's final price setting.

title: Hers
description: AT 8 o'clock last Tuesday morning I turned on the televison for my daily dose of Righteous Outrage. It was a little early for Righteous Outrage. Usually, I begin indulging at 9 A.M. by making phone calls to people who never seem to appear in their offices before 10:30. By 10:30, I have taken the phone off the hook in a fit of Righteous Outrage at all those people who are out jogging around the block while I am trying to reach them. How dare they not accommodate themselves to my schedule! How noble, by comparison to the traditionally employed, are we freelancers, working feverishly 24 hours a day  except for those weeks we spend becoming authorities on trash novels.

title: A CARTER BID TO AID JACKSON TRIP CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 President Carter personally interceded in an effort to persuade Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel to receive the Rev. Jesse L. Jackson, the black activist leader, American and Israeli sources said today.

title: Officer Named to Lead Caribbean Task Force
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (UPI)  The Pentagon said today that Rear Adm. Thomas Replogle had been named to head the new joint task force headquarters in Key West, Fla., and Defense Secretary Harold Brown will meet with him there on Monday.

title: ABROAD AT HOME The Cuban Molehill
description: BOSTON, Oct. 3  It was awkward surgery on a selfinflicted wound, and performed well enough considering the difficulty. But it remains to be seen whether President Carter's speech can repair the damage done to the strategic arms treaty by his own Administration's foolishness over Soviet troops in Cuba.

title: A Quiet Leader For Nigerians Shehu Shagari
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Oct. 3  Nigeria's new civilian President, the first after more than 13 years of military rule, prides himself on being a contact person, someone who meets scores of ordinary people every day and inquires about their troubles.

title: Perry of Holy Cross Five Undergoes Knee Surgery
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Oct. 3 (AP)Ronnie Perry, the basketball and baseball star at Holy Cross College here, underwent exploratory knee surgery in Boston today to remedy persistent pain diagnosed as resulting from tendinitis.

title: Horizon Land Sales Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP) A Federal Trade Commission judge today accused the Horizon Corporation, a landsales concern based in Tucson, Ariz., of vicious consumer fraud and ordered It to assist its customers.

title: The Region
description: OCEAN GROVE, N.J.  The New Jersey Supreme Court has ruled that the Methodist enclave of Ocean Grove may continue to govern itself until Jan. 1. The extension was requested by Ocean Grove officials, who said that they needed more time to dismantle the municipal government.

title: Dance: Michio Ito Salute
description: FOR anyone interested in the roots of American modern dance, a new important program in tribute to the late Michio Ito is an absolute must. It runs through Sunday at the Theater of the Open Eye at 316 East 88th Street.

title: Deciphering Monetary Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  Disagreements over the course monetary policy should take are nothing new. But in recent weeks such discord has reached one of its cyclical peaks that makes one wonder whether there are any monetary truths at all. Not onlyis there debate over what is likely to occur but also there is confusion over what is occurring now, over what has alreadyhappened and over what is desirable.

title: Deaths
description: BLEIBERGDorothy. Beloved wife of Daniel. Devoted mother of Robyn Roller. Adored grandmother of JIIIlan. Dear sister of Lou Marie. Services Thursday Oct 4th, 10:15AM The Riverside 76th St 8 Amsterdam Ave.

title: Obituary 8  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. (516) ?? ??; CONNECTICUT (203) 3457767.

title: Fuel Stocks Rise Sharply in Week
description: The extraordinary oneweek increase pushed these critical inventories into the Department of Energy's projected normal range for the first time since February, when stocks plunged in weeks from normal to well below the minimum acceptable level That decline came toward the end of the Iranian oil cutoff.

title: Questions and Answers on Issue of Soviet Troops in Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The monthlong controversy over Soviet troops in Cuba was addressed by President Carter in a report to the nation on Monday, but some confusion seems to persist. What follows, in questionandanswer form, is a summary of the current situation.

title: Stage: Stoppard's Dogg's Hamlet Opens
description: Do you speak Dogg? You don't learn it. You catch it, says character in Tom Stoppard's Dogg's Hamlet, Cahoot's Macbeth, which opened last night at 22 Steps Theater. The language and thelaughter are contagious, at least during the first half of this twopart wordplay, which marks the debut in New York of the British American Repertory Company.

title: Texas International And NFC to Merge
description: The Texas International Company and the NFC Corporation, two Oklahoma City companies in the oil and gas exploration business, announced that they had agreed in principle to aq merger valued at about $65 million.

title: South Africa Tops Devon In Rugby Opener, 2718
description: EXETER, England, Oct. 3 (UPI)The Barbarians, the touring multiracial rugby team from South Africa, defeated Devon by 2718 today in the first of the eight matches that they are to play in Britain.

title: Kucinich Faces an Uphill Fight in Runoff in Cleveland
description: CLEVELAND, Oct. 3  Dennis J. Kucinich, the embattled 32yearold Mayor who narrowly survived a recall effort less than a year ago, faced an uphill fight today in his quest for a second term.

title: Captain Of Pirate Vessel
description: CINCINNATI, Oct. 3  At a quick glance, the Pittsburgh Pirates fit their nickname better than any other baseball team. With their mustaches, beards and sometimes straggly hair, they indeed resemble pirates.

title: Stocks Mixed as Trading Slows
description: The stock market ended mixed yesterday in slower trading as the dollar firmed against several major currencies and the price of gold fell sharply in trading abroad.

title: Letters; Washington's Perfidy in the Vietnam War; Westway vs. the Need to Conserve; In Defense of Abrams; Hurdle to the Reform Of Cigarette Taxes; An Overoptimistic Hungarian Grasp for a Full Market Economy; What If Gold Goes to $1,000 an Ounce?; Costly Tellico Victory
description: To the Editor:

title: Walkout by School Bus Drivers Strands 900 Handicapped Pupils
description: About 900 handicapped publicschool children were stranded at bus stops throughout New York City yesterday when the union representing schoolbus drivers struck at four small companies.

title: Theater: Deli's Fable
description: SUSAN DWORKIN'S Deli's Fable is juicy and imaginative, sometimes obscure, and stuffed not so much with ideas as it is with impulses, or, if you will, prejudices. The impulses, or prejudices, are Miss Dworkin's, or course, although she has made of them not a tract, but an authentic work of the imagination. In this polemical time, Deli's Fable is a triumph right there. It is at Playhouse 46 in St. Clement's Church.

title: Saudis Hint Oil Output May Drop
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Oct. 3 Saudi Arabia's finance minister told forum of international monetary officials and private bankers today that his country was considering new cutbacks in oil production because of the eroding value of the dollar.

title: Chrysler Sells Realty Unit
description: DETROIT, Oct. 3 (UPI) The Chrysler Corporation said today that it completed the sale of the Chrysler Realty Corporation to ABKO Realty Inc. of Wichita, Kan., for $195 million. The subsidiary was formed in 1967 to help develop Chrysler's dealership properties. The accord assures Chrysler of the continued availability of dealership sites owned by Chrysler Realty.

title: Louisiana Police Official Pleads Not Guilty to Enslaving 2 Aliens
description: MONROE, La., Oct. 3 (UPI) A north Louisiana official has pleaded not guilty to an 11count Federal indictment charging him with enslaving two Mexican aliens on his farm.

title: . . . Or a Home Can Take a Lot of Energy
description: VENICE, CALIF. THREE years ago, the abandoned service station, built of reinforced concrete made to look like adobe, was an empty shell. Nevertheless, Charles Denson, a magazine art director who had just moved to Los Angeles, decided to convert it into a home.

title: Ethics Unit Sees Lying in Inquiry About Talmadge
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The senate Select Committee on Ethics said today that it had uncovered half a dozen or so possible violations of Federal laws in its long investigation into Senator Herman E. Talmadge's finances.

title: Turning a Connecticut Cottage Into a Finnish Home
description: HE is proud of her beauty; she of his talent. With her, what other ornament is needed? he asks. See how fine he makes our house, she declares.

title: Accused Justice Gets Delay
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Oct. 3 (UPI)  A judge has granted Justice Paul N. HaIvoMk of the State District Court of Appeal a week's delay in entering a plea to marijuana charges. Judge Roderic Duncan of Municipal Court agreed yesterday to delay Justice Halvonik's hearing until next Tuesday after Terry Bruiniers, a Deputy District Attorney, said that he would not object because of some allegations that require further investigation.

title: Rural Energy Plan Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  The Senate Agriculture Committee approved a $2 billion a year rural energy plan today. Supporters of the legislation said the plan could make American food and forest industries independent of foreign energy by the year 2000.

title: It Can't Happen Here
description: Our money shall just have begun to tremble and flutter into paper.

title: Obituary 7  No Title
description: Deaths

title: 10Day And '79 Car Sales Off
description: DETROIT, Oct. 3 (AP)  Newcar sales by the Big Three automobile companies declined 21 percent in the final 10 days of September from the yearearlier level, while sales for the entire 1979 model year, which ended Sunday, declined 6.8 percent, the companies reported.

title: Fuel Board Survives Key Test in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  President Carter's energy mobilization board, a key segment of his program to reduce national reliance on imported oil, survived its first test on the Senate floor today and appeared headed for approval largely intact.

title: Gibson States He Told All to the Grand Jury
description: NEWARK, Oct. 3  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson, through his attorney, today released a onesentence statement in response to reports that a Federal grand jury is investigating campaign fundraising activities conducted during his 1974 reelection campaign

title: 137 Recruiters Taken Off Duties In Inquiry by Army on Practices
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (AP)  One hundredthirtyseven Army recruiters have so far been removed from their duties in an investigation of suspected malpractices, chiefly helping substandard volunteers to cheat on entrance examinations.

title: Florida's Caucuses Seen As 'stacked for Carter
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Oct. 3  Gerald Lewis, Florida State Comptroller and chairman of the Florida for Kennedy Committee, charged today that procedures for the Oct. 13 county caucuses were stacked in favor of President Carter and against the movement to draft Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Lewis W. Foy has made himself a fixture as chairman of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, a job he has held since 1974, but next spring Mr. Foy is scheduled to retire at the age of 65. At that point, if past is precedent, Bethlehem's board is likely to turn for his successor to a steel man who has spentmost of his working life at Bethlehem but just possibly to two younger executives, one of whom joined the company as recently as 1977.

title: Knicks Defeat Bullets
description: HARRISONBURG, Va., Oct.3 (UPI)  Bill Cartwright, a rookie center, scored 18 points and grabbed 13 rebounds tonight to carry the New York Knicks to a 8781 exhibition victory over the Washington Bullets.

title: 6Nation Tour Set for Bergland
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (Reuters) Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland will visit Egypt, Israel and four West European countries next month to discuss trade and other issues, the Agriculture Department announced today. He will arrive in Egypt Nov. 3.

title: A Final Charter Offer To Rhodesians Made By London at Parley
description: LONDON, Oct. 3 Britain put forward today what it said was its final draft of a constitution for Zimbabwe Rhodesia, and then adjourned until Monday the conference that it is conducting here, with a plea for agreement on the document then.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a production error in late editions of The Times yesterday, a list of survivors of Walter Hendricks appeared in the obituary of the Rev. Brother Arthur A. Loftus, former president of Iona College. Brother Loftus had no survivors.

title: Trade Body Cites Soviet Ammonia
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3  The United States International Trade Commission ruled today that imports of ammonia from the Soviet Union were harming American producers.

title: Group in Belmar, N.J., Protests Life of Brian
description: A Belmar, N.J., theater that has been picketed for showing the controversial movie Monty Python's Life of Brian has been asked by the town council to consider removing the film from exhibition.

title: G.O.P. Senators Urge Javits and Goldwater to Run
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 3 (UPI)  Republican colleagues today urged Senators Jacob K. Javits of New York and Barry Goldwater of Arizona to seek reelection next year and increase the party's chances of winning control of the Senate for the first time in a generation.

title: PRODUCER PRICES UP 1.4% IN SEPTEMBER; FUEL AND FOOD SOAR
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4  The Government's index of producer prices, intended to anticipate future price trends at the retail level, shot up 1.4 percent in September, the largest monthly increase in almost five years, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Hundreds Are Homeless After Tornado in Connecticut
description: WINDSOR, Conn., Oct. 4  Stunned residents in this area of northcentral Connecticut picked up what they could today from homes smashed by a tornado yesterday that left two people dead, 115 families homeless and caused 143 others to be hospitalized, Connecticut officials reoorted.

title: 5Borough Bike Race Hits Road Sunday
description: THEY call it the Apple Lap, but don't confuse it for a pastoral rite of autumn in an upstate orchard. It promises to be as urban as New York City itself, as grueling as the IRT in the morning rush hour, as exciting as the Cyclone at Coney Island. It is, to be more precise, a 75mile bicycle race through all five boroughs that will start like a cavalry charge at 7:50 A.M. on Sunday morning in the Granitevine section of Staten Island and gasp to a finish approximately three hours later at the steps the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Fifth Avenue.

title: Jordi FolchiPi Dies, 68; A Pioneer Neurochemist
description: Jordi FolchiPi, professor of neurochemistry emeritus at Harvard University, died Wednesday at his home in Boston. He was 68 years old.

title: The City
description: Jennifer Chance, a 14yearold Jamaican girl who had been flown here by New Yorkers earlier this week for heart operation that was to save her life, died yesterday before undergoingsurgery.

title: Economic Scene
description: AS the frantic actions in the gold and currency markets this week have shown, anxieties have been rising that the United States and the world economy may be facing a breakdown comparable to the crash half a century ago.

title: Ford and U.A.W. Agree on Pact
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Oct. 4  The Ford Motor Company and the United Auto Workers reached tentative agreement on a new threeyear contract tonight, avoiding by half an hour the deadline the union had set for a strike.

title: Rangers Lose, 54, To Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 4 (AP) Bobby Clarke scored a goal with 2 minutes 39 seconds remaining as the Philadelphia Flyers completed their National Hockey League exhibition schedule with a 54 victory over the New York Rangers tonight.

title: The Mood Is Playful At Showinxs in Milan
description: MILAN, Oct. 3  When the Italians invite the fashion world in for a visit, their hospitality is boundless. Milan, which has bloomed in the last few years as a design center, introduced its fashions for spring and summer 1980 in an atmosphere of efficiency as well as good cheer this week.

title: Five Named to Challenge Big Two in the Gold Cup
description: Affirmed and Spectacular Bid will have a little more company in tomorrow's Jockey Club Gold Cup than anyone had expected.

title: Carter Accepts Kreps Resignation
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4 (AP) President Carter accepted the resignation of Commerce Secretary Juanita M. Kreps today with the greatest reluctance and regret.

title: Klan Leader Debates Racial Bias With Ralph Abernathy at Campus
description: ALFRED, N.Y., Oct. 4 (AP)  It's not affirmative action  it's racism, and it's about time we ended it, David Duke, grand wizard of the Ku Klux Klan, said at the Alfred University campus here last night in a debate with the civilrights leader Ralph Abernathy.

title: U.S. Proposes 3 Ways to Enforce OilImport Quotas
