description: Lucille Hardin de Zalduondo, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jose Antonio de Zalduondo of New York and Nantucket, Mass., was married yesterday in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church to Richard Henry Briance, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Albert Briance of London. The Rev. Dr. David H.C. Read performed the ceremony.

title: Port Authority Votes 2 New Air Terminals
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has cleared the way for construction of terminals at La Guardia and Newark International Airports.

title: Miss Brown, D.M. Weir 2d Are Married
description: The Episcopal Church of the Transfiguration (the Little Church Around the Corner) was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Marshall Marian Brown, daughter of Mrs. Stanton Griffis of Palm Beach, Fla., and the late Thaddeus Harold Brown Jr. of Washington, to David Manson Weir 2d.He is a son of the late Ernest Tener Weir of Pittsburgh and Hobe Sound, Fla., and the late Mary Hayward Weir. The Rev. Allan Warren performed the ceremony.

title: Robert Meisel, Lawyer, Marries Carol F. Duncan
description: Carol Faith Duncan, daughter of Lois Duncan of Norwalk, Conn., and Wilbur S. Duncan of Darien, Conn., was married yesterday in Austin, Tex., to Robert Christopher Meisel. The ceremonywas performed at the home of the bridegroom by Judge Jon Wisser of the Travis County CourtatLaw No. 3 in Austin.

title: The Region
description: Politics has imperatives that make enmity a luxury and amity a necessity, which is why Mayor Koch sought rapprochement with blacks by meeting last month with Harlem Representative Charles B. Rangel and black members of the City Council. Last week, it was the Hispanics turn. The Mayor met for 90 minutes with Representative Robert Garcia of the Bronx and City Council members Luis A. Olmedo of Brooklyn, Gilberto GerenaValentin of the Bronx and Robert Rodriguez of Manhattan.

title: Major News
description: Shock therapy may be in disrepute in some psychiatric circles. But as demonstrated by Federal Reserve chairman Paul A. Volcker's Saturday night special  a stringent program of monetary restraint  inducing convulsive reactions is still an acceptable prescription for high economic anxiety.

title: New Outlets In Medicine
description: THERE was a time when someone going into the hospital for a few days could expect to be treated, for the most part, by doctors and nurses. Today, a hospital visit might begin with the services of an electrocardiograph technician, a medicallaboratory worker and a dietitian.

title: Dance: Two Jonathan Hollander Premieres
description: Battery and Brass, a joint program by Jonathan Hollander's Battery Dance Company and the Apple Brass Quintet at Marymount Manhattan Theater Friday night, offered a rarity in an already overloaded dance season: The surprise of fresh experience.

title: Libya's Identity Blurred by Ties With East, West and Terrorism
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  One scorching afternoon last month, Libya's port city of Benghazi reverberated to a thundering parade of Sovietmade arms, including T72 tanks and MIG25 jet fighters never before shown off in the Middle East.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Deaths

title: A Correction
description: The address of the Freehold Antique and Craft Center is 27 South Street, Freehold, not 27 Front Street, as listed here last week. The center is open from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M., Wednesday through Saturday, and from noon to 5 P.M. on Sundays.

title: In Game of Numbers, These Are the Ones That Really Count
description: BASEBALL is not a game of inches. Only uninformed outsiders like Howard Cosell even think such thoughts. Baseball is actually a game of numbers. Without statistics, the baseball junkie is a beached whale. Eachyear, 600 gated major leaguers, plus many Mets, exert themselves all summer with one goal  to compile numbers for fans to think about during the winter. To facilitate this process, here are some crucial numbers for this winter.

title: Events Today
description: The Atlantic Antic: Entertainment, foods and crafts; events begin at 10:30 A.M.; Atlantic Avenue from Hicks Street to Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Japan Physical Fitness Study Finds Some Flaws
description: TOKYO, Oct. 13  Every morning here, a stream of joggers circles the several miles of moat surrounding the Imperial Palace. At 3 P.M. radios in Government offices are tuned to the national network's daily exercise program and almost everyone stops work to perform a prescribed set of calisthenics.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: GOLD AND IRON, by Fritz Stern. (Vintage, $7.95.) Fritz Stern draws on much fresh archival material to tell how Otto von Bismarck built the German Empire, paying particular attention to the considerable role played by the Jewish financier Gerson von Bleichrder. James Joll, our reviewer, called this wellwritten study a major contribution to our understanding of some of the great themes of modern European history  the relations between Jews and Germans, between economics and politics, between banking and diplomacy.

title: Updating a Bathroom With New Fixtures
description: THE mere thought of remodeling a bathroom, which costs a minimum of $3,500 and a month's patience, can hurl a homeowner into the slough of despond.A good alternative, though, is simply to update the room with a bright new fixture or two, making the space more efficient at the same time. Trade the tub in for a whirlpool bath, install a marriagesaving lavatory with two basins, or add a functional novelty  a bidet or a urinal.

title: C. W. Post Notches Fourth in Row, 143
description: Lou Buschi fired touchdown passes of 52 and 72 yards to Tom Capone to lead C.W. Post to its fourth straight victory, 143, over American International College yesterday at Hickox Memorial Field in Brookville, L.I.

title: Crafts Shops Thrive In Suburban Settings
description: WHEN Minda Shein of East Brunswick, N.J., was hunting for a very special thankyou gift, she headed for the Lillian Kornbluth Gallery in Fair Lawn, where she purchased an unusual ceramic landscape plate by Albert Green. Lucy and Dick Feller of Westport, Conn., made a similar beeline for the Elements Gallery in Greenwich, where they were seeking a oneofakind gift for a oneofakind friend.

title: Fighting Inflation: The No Frills of It All
description: TODAY the average housewife must be constantly vigilant in her battle to stretch the dwindling value of her husband's paycheck. Sometimes I resent the lengths I am driven to in order to protect my family from advancing inflation.

title: CAPITAL REPORT
description: LAST summer, when the Legislature reluctantly agreed to let the state get into the bus business, it set up a sevenmember board to take charge. One of the perogatives of the board, which would include four members of the general public, would be to buy private bus lines and out them under state control.

title: Two Suspects Arrested in Jersey In Theft of Video Tape Recorders
description: NEWARK, Oct. 13 (AP)  Two men have been arrested in North Bergen in connection with the theft of more than $400,000 worth of video tape recorders, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: One of the achievements of the 1970's is the systematic revaluation of Claude Monet, in print and in more than one major American museum. Monet was not very bright, people used to say. As one of the founding fathers of French Impressionism, he would be forever in the history books. His place in popular esteem was secure, also. Few of us forget our first sight of Monet's poplars, Monet's haystacks, Monet's Houses of Parliament, Monet's waterlilies. His Terrace at SainteAdresse has been one of the most popular paintings in the Metropolitan Museum ever since it was acquired in 1967.

title: STAMPS
description: Sir Rowland Hill, the Briton who conceived for his country the world's first uniform system for inexpensive prepaid postage, and often called father of the postage stamp, is cornmemorated by Britain with a set of four multicolored verticals that epitomize his achievement and mark the centenary of his death.

title: Children Need Help to Overcome Learning Ailment
description: LEARNING disabilities have been around for a long time. Leonardo da Vinci had them; so did Louis Pasteur, Albert Einstein and Thomas Edison.

title: Health Building Scores Success as Gallery
description: HAUPPAUGE IN recent years many institutions such as banks, post offices, libraries and even shopping centers have sought to demonstrate their sensitivity to the cultural needs of the community by sponsoring art exhibitions in their lobbies and public rooms.

title: Other World Events
description: It took Joe Clark more than four months after his inauguration as Canadian Prime Minister to call Parliament into session. Judging from his Conservative Government's program introduced last week, it was hard to see what Justified the wait. The program was largely a rehash of his electoral platform. It promised a renewed emphasis on private enterprise and anew era in federalprovincial relations but did not mention Quebec's secessionist movement or the dispute between Ottawa and several Western provinces over prices and profits for oil and natural gas. These issues should be addressed next week at a conference of provincial and federal cabinet ministers in Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Elegance Returning to Old Mansion
description: SOUTHAMPTON THERE'S a world of elegance concealed behind a lush green privet hedge on Hill Street here where, at the turn of the century, a celebrated architect designed a seaside summer cottage for one of his wealthy friends.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: The death of Preston Jones at the age of 43 represents a loss for the American, as well as regional, theater. When his A Texas Trilogy opened Broadway in 1976, it was greeted with skepticism and even hostility. These were three overlapping, realistic plays about life in a small Texas town  and the consensus seemed to be: small town, small drama. The plays closed precipitously, and Mr. Jones returned to Dallas to continue writing plays and acting for his home company, the Dallas Theater Center.

title: Rough Times Ahead
description: IN 1950, Social Security paid out $1 billion in old age and survivors pensions. This year, at a total cost of $104 billion, one American in seven will receive some sort of benefit from Social Security. By 1984, the system will be churning out at least $192 billion annually in pension checks and reimbursements for hospital care. what is most remarkable about these numbers is not that we have allowed them to grow so rapidly; other wealthy countries spend equivalent amounts on the care of the old, sick and disabled. The real puzzle is that the largest social welfare program in the world has evolved with so little political controversy.

title: In Fall, the House Is a Home Again
description: RANDOM thoughts to ponder, while waiting for my daughter Katie to finish her ritual in the bathroom:

title: Baltimore Wins, 96
description: Baltimore rallied with six runs in the eighth inning to beat Pittsburgh, 96, and take a 31 lead in the World Series. Details in Section 5.

title: Fog Closes Vancouver Airport
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Oct: 13 (AP)  Hundreds of passengers have been stranded at Vancouver International Airport as dense fog halted most plane arrivals and departures for the last two days. The fog blanket is reported by the regional weather office to be up to a thousand feet thick in places.

title: Edgar Speer, Former Chairman Of United States Steel, Dies at 63
description: Edgar B. Speer, former chairman and chief executive officer of the United States Steel Corporation, died of cancer yesterday at his home in Fox Chapel, Pa., a suburb of Pittsburgh. He was 63 years old.

title: Buying a Home With a Partner
description: ACCUSTOMED to living in elegant surroundings for most of their married lives, neither Jane Avery nor Barbara Williamson cared for the idea of ending up alone in a small apartment after they each Rot divorced six years ago.

title: Fields Of the Future
description: WHEN making career decisions, most people go through the same anxious motions, asking advice and encouragement from friends and family, consulting guidance or career counselors, talking with people already working. Then they finally hit the street. But how do the leaders in various occupational fields  often the people who do the hiring  look at the future of their fields?

title: The Almost Equal Black
description: THE prospects of skilled and educated blacks finding the jobs they trained for have improved considerably in recent generations. The fields of science, sales, accounting, corn puter analysis and electronics require so continual a flow of qualified entrylevel workers that equal opportunity at that level approaches being a reality.

title: West Virginia Agency Calls Halt To Flexibility in Workers Hours
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va., Oct. 13 (AP) A program to allow employees of the State Labor Department to set their own working schedules is being scrapped just two months after it started.

title: Expanded Manassas Park Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 (UPI)  The House voted Tuesday, 349 to 39, to expand Manassas National Battlefield Park in an effort to prevent development of prime land in the area adjoining the present Virginia parkland. The bill goes to an uncertain fate in the Senate, which has failed to act on similar bills over the past four years. The bill would authorize $20 million for land acquisition to expand the park from 3,000 acres to 4,175 acres. Manassas was the site of two major battles in the Civil War.

title: Marriage Announcement 19  No Title
description: Margaret Drake Plans May Bridal

title: Sinneran Is Suffern Star
description: In a battle of undefeated teams, Suffern edged Clarkstown South, 80, yesterday. Suffern ended a 12game winning streak for Clarkstown as Chris Sinneran pounced on a goalline fumblefor a touchdown. Tony DeFrancisco ran for the extra point. Suffern has yet to be scored upon this season.

title: Montreal Transit Workers Strike In a Dispute Over Contract Talks
description: MONTREAL, Oct. 12 (UPI)  About 2,000 municipal maintenance workers, bitter over lagging contract talks, plunged Montreal into its fifth transit strike in as many years today, forcing commuters to seek other means of travel.

title: DINING OUT
description: IN recent years, the cuisine of China's Hunan Province seems to have won many American devotees as there are Hunanese. One of the most respected of the Hunanese chefs in New York has been Peng ChangKwei, owner of Peng's restaurant in Manhattan since 1976. Now a new Peng's restaurant with an almost identical menu has opened in the readily accessible part of southern Westchester. That is happy news for anyone who likes Chinese food.

title: Peles Brother Learns as He Teaches
description: PURCHASE AS athletic director at Manhattanville College, Joe Daunic knew that the students wanted to form a varsity soccer team  but they didn't want a student to coach it. He also knew that the athletic department couldn't afford to pay top dollar for a professional coach. It was summertime, and he had promised women's varsity team for the fall.

title: U.S. Report on Arms Budgets Says Soviet Spends Third of World Total
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 (AP)  The Soviet Union spent $140 billion on its armed forces in 1977, accounting for almost a third of global military spending, according to a United States Government report made public today.

title: Midlife Changes Become a Way of Life
description: FIVE YEARS ago Louisa Lang would awaken each morning at 5:30, listen carefully to the early business reports, and struggle through the rush hour to get to Wall Street where she worked as an institutional block trader for Lehman Brothers. Today Miss Lang, who has been working as an artist since 1974  I found that using my handsand excelling at something of a personal nature was more fulfilling than working with big blocks of money  rarely gets up before 10 A.M., rarely wears a dress and rarely hurries to an earlymorning business appointment. Instead, she spends her days designing stainedglass lamps and painting pictures in her St. Mark's studio.

title: Waya Captures Beldame
description: An afternoon that started in neartragedy for Cash Asmussen ended in a striking victory yesterday when he rode the Frenchbred Waya to victory in the $161,750 Beldame Stakes at Belmont.

title: $41 Million U.S. Funds For Cable Cars Backed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 13 (UPI) Secretary of Transportation Neil E.Goldschmidt said yesterday that modernizing San Francisco's centuryold cable cars was worth a $41 million investment of Federal funds and was in line with the Carter Administration's mass transit program. He said the cable cars have a constituency around the country.

title: KalmuckAmericans Welcome Dalai Lama To Temples in Jersey
description: HOWELL TOWNSHIP, N.J., Oct. 13The Dnlai Lama visited three Lamaist Buddhist temples in this rural area of Monmouth County today, where he urged more than 1,000 KalmuckAmericans to preserve their Mongol heritage and to continue practicing their Tibetanstyle Buddhism.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 13 (UPI)  Confidential memorandums of the Ford Motor Company show that company officials knew before they began producing the Pinto that its gas tank was especially susceptible to explosion in lowspeed crashes, The Chicago Tribune reported today.

title: Penn State Wins
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Oct. 13 Matt Suhey's grandfather was an allAmerica end at Penn State, and his father was an allAmerica guard here. Today, the latest in the long line of family standouts gave the 77,157 fans present cause to believe that more national recognition may be in store.

title: ON THE ISLE
description: Today

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Jerusalem was the site of the International Seminar on the Bible in Dance this summer under the auspices of the Israeli Center of the International Theater Institute. Inevitably, the event that made the most news was the performance by the Egyptian ballet dancer, Reda Sheta (seen here with the Berlin Opera Ballet), as Abraham and Moses in Prophetic Visions. The work was created by Israeli choreographer Domy ReiterSoffer for Israel's Bat Dor Dance Company.

title: Blankets of Air Heat Solar House
description: BEDFORD WITH shorter autumn days and colder nights, home owners are beginning to turn on their furnaces with regularity  and with anguish over rising fuel costs. But not so for Joshua Arnow, builder of a solarheated house that is now being completed on a fouracre site and will be ready for occupancy next month.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: Continued

title: Tristate Area to Receive $1 Billion in CETA Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13  The Labor Department will announce on Monday the distribution of more than $1 billion in CETA funds for the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut area in 1980. Of the total, $76 million is designated for communities with high unemployment.

title: Caring For the Aged: Harsh Reality
description: TRENTON THE major illness of older people is depression, says Sylvia Tumin, a social worker at a nursingretirement home here. It reflects the reality growing old in this society.

title: Retired U.S. Navy Officer Charged In Gunfight With Australia Police
description: PERTH, Australia, Oct. 13 (AP)  Authorities charged a retired United States Navy officer at his bedside in an Australian hospital today with attempted murder in connection with a gunfight at his farm in western Australia.

title: Gasohol Outlets Continue to Expand
description: GASOHOL sales in the New YorkNew JerseyConnecticut area are continuing to grow, despite a return to nearnormal gasoline supplies and an end to oddeven gasoline sales.

title: `Embryonic Presidential Effort Here Keeps a Brown Aide Bustling
description: On Oct. 2, a 28yearold California lawyer named Thomas Flynn arrived in New York, rented a room at the Tudor Hotel on East 42d Street and scanned a short list of names and telephone numbers. Thus began Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.'s Presidential campaign in New York State.

title: Hispanic Dance Gains Foothold In New York
description: The fact that two Hispanic dance companies are appearing in New York during the first two weeks of October seems to have gone unnoticed by statisticians and proclamation makers. The Puerto Rican DanceTheater opened at the Theater of the Riverside Church on Thursday and runs through this afternoon. The Ballet Hispanico of New York opens Wednesday at the Dance Umbrella festival for a fourperformance run.

title: Music: Debuts in Review
description: Ira Goodkin, a pianist who teaches at the University of Illinois campus in Chicago, played a three B's program  Bach, Beethoven and Binkerd  at his New York debut Tuesday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Gordon Binkerd, a composition teacher who retired eight years ago from the university's Urbana faculty, was represented by his Essays for the Piano (1974). The Bach was the English Suite No. 2 in A minor, and the Beethoven, the last piano sonata, Op. 111.

title: Switching Error Blamed for Train Crash That Killed 2 Near Chicago
description: HARVEY, Ill., Oct. 13 (AP)  A railroad worker apparently threw a switch too soon and sent an Amtrak passenger train crashing head on into a parked freight train, killing two people and injuring 44 others, investigators said today.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 354?? UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691600; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: U.S. Magistrate Role to Widen
description: WASHINGTON, D.C. THEY are a rare breed in the Federal court system, usually little noticed but now on the threshold of expanded responsibility to help clear dockets more efficiently.

title: Controlled and Stabilized Rents Defined
description: In New York City, an apartment is rentcontrolled if it is in a building constructed before 1997 and the tenant lived there before 1971. Rentcontrolled tenants have no leases since they are statutory tenants and the Rent Guidelines Board has no power over them.

title: MUSIC
description: IT'S a wonderful experience in our life, Ann Schein said, and each time it gets more special. The Scarsdale pianist was talking about the sonata performances she has been giving recently with her husband, Earl Carlyss, the violinist and, in particular, the concerttonight at the HoffBarthelson School, which will mark their New York debut as a duet. In Earl's busy season, the possibility of playing together doesn't happen nearly so often as we would like, but when it does, it was incredibly expanding. You really feel as if the music is growing right under you, and you grow with it.

title: Jetsam of a Black Wednesday: A Flop for I.B.M.
description: The International Business Machines Corporation may have wowed the stock market for decades, but its debut in the bond market was a flop during a tough week for the company.

title: In Summary SALT Prospects Are Linked to Missiles for Europe
description: The Nation

title: Ravi Tikkoo, Shipowner
description: Ravi Tikkoo grew up in the landlocked state of Kashmir, in the heart of the Himalayas. At age 20, as an officer in the Indian Navy, he saw the sea for the first time, and he saw a part for him in it. He became a shipowner, and today the 46yearold Mr. Tikkoo, along with the likes of the Greek Onassis heirs and the Norwegian Reckstens isone of the world's biggest individual owners of ships, including two monstrous oil tankers that, until a couple of years ago, were the largest things afloat anywhere.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS As Others See Us
description: WASHINGTON  Foreign diplomats, businessmen and journalists passing through this town are extraordinarily bold in their condemnation of the Carter Administration  and most of its critics as well.

title: Iran Denies Cut in Oil Production
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Oct. 13 (UPI) Iran's Minister of Petroleum today denied reports attributed to him that Iran had cut oil output, saying that production had held steady at four million barrels a day.

title: Cambodia Approves Relief Plan and Airlift Begins
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 13 (AP) A British cargo plane flew relief supplies today from here to the Cambodian capital of Phnom Penh today and it was announced that the Cambodian Government had given approval to a 30nation effort to head off starvation in the country.

title: New, From the Rabbit Warren
description: The Rabbits are doing what's expected of them  proliferating. Not only are sales soaring for Volkswagen but model lines are growing. For 1980, VW has added a Rabbit convertible and a pickup truck.

title: Explosion to Be Investigated
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 (AP)  A sub committee of the House Commerce Committee will investigate an explosion last Saturday that killed one worker and injured another at a Cove Point, Md., liquified natural gas storage plant, Representative John D. Dingell, Democrat of Michigan, said today.

title: Cedarhurst School Sale Faces Hurdle
description: CEDARHURST THE issue of how to dispose of a school property that is no longer needed for education is causing concern in this Five Towns community.

title: Letters to the Travel Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Curtain Rising on a Rich Season
description: WITH brilliant fall foliage and a bracing nip in the air comes the promise of a bright season of entertainment in the state, and changes at some of the traditional fonts of culture.

title: BBC Voice in the Wilderness Threatened With Laryngitis
description: LONDON  A dissident in East Berlin tunes in to a hidden radio, which he regards as his only source of truth; out on the Pacific, a Japanese merchant seaman sits on the deck at midnight, listening to the news in his native language; in a remote and dusty village in northern Nigeria, farmers tether their camels at the end of the day and gather around a transistor set hung from a tree branch to hear the news in Hausa, their only link with the world beyond.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Leonid and Valentina Kozlov, who had been members of the Bolshoi Ballet until they defected to the West last month, will be performing in New York Saturday and next Sunday. The dancers will appear as guest artists with the Maryland Ballet at Whitman Hall of Brooklyn College. The program is to include Petipa's La Bayadere Variation as well as the New York premiere of a new pas de deux choreographed by the Bolshoi's premier danseur Vladimir Vasiliev. The rest of the program includes Three Preludes to music by Rachmaninoff and Three Dances to Japanese Music. (See Dance)

title: Jillaine R. Williams Bride in Bronxville
description: Jillaine Rae Williams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thurman W. Williams of Port Charlotte, Fla., was married yesterday to Roscoe Cunningham Ingalls 3d, son of Mr. Ingalls Jr. of Bronxville, N.Y., and the late Mrs. Ingalls. Theceremony was pertormea in me Keformed Church of Bronxville by the Rev. Dr. Charles L. Copenhaver.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: PAINTING conventional doublehung windows (the kind that slide up and down) has always been somewhat of a problem for the doityourself painter. Not onlydo you have to worry about trying to keep paint off the glass, there is also the oftenconfusing problem of figuring out what sequence to follow so that all parts of both the upper and the lower sash will get painted without skipping any strips of molding  and without getting paint all over your hands as you repeatedly move the sash frames up and down.

title: WardrobeBuilding In Valley Stream
description: VALLEY STREAM THERE are sales under way at several stores in the Green Acres shopping center here, and bargains to be had in many others.

title: THEATER
description: IN every theatergoer's life there comes an evening when he is faced with a smash hit in which he can't see much merit. I think The Unsinkable Molly Brown may be that show for me. Checking through theatrical records, I see that it opened on Broadway on Nov. 3, 1960, and stayed there for 532 performances. Ican only suppose that its success had something to do with Tammy Grimes's ability in the leading role. It certainly couldn't have been Meredith Willson's score, which aside from one brassy march rhythm offers up some of the worst ballads I've ever heard.

title: Little Bulbs Can Be Forced in a Big Way
description: Hyacinths, tulips and daffodils are, in my estimation, rather ordinary choices for forcing in pots. There are so many other delightful smaller bulbs in perfect scale for interior decor. Consider such delights as miniature daffodils or tulips, scillas, crocus and grape hyacinths.

title: Potvin Explains Islanders Goal: To Atone for the Past
description: IN junior hockey we called our team bus the iron lung  our transportation around the back roads of Ontario. Now an iron lung carrying major leaguers was rumbling east on 34th Street on the wet, rainy night of May 8, 1979. It was 11:10 P.M. andthrough blurred windows (or was eyes?) screaming people gestured obscenely at the bus. The crowd's yells were slowly and gradually muffled, as we left Manhattan Island. But the noise of cheers and jeers of our final hockey night in Madison Square Garden were much harder to silence. They are to be resounding in our minds until the day of reckoning, the day we win the Stanley Cup.

title: A Few Frugal Thoughts From PartyGiving Pros
description: The suggestions, ideas and advice were thrown around with the generosity of peanuts at a cocktail party, but nothing less could have been expected of a seminar entitled New Concepts in Creative Entertaining. It was not, of course, all new, nor, for that matter, allcreative. But that scarcely mattered to some 90 men and women from across the country who had paid $820 each to attend the twoday meeting at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel.

title: PREMIER SAYS MALTA MUST STAY NEUTRAL
description: VALLETTA, Malta  In 1971, when we took office, we had an English governorgeneral, an English queen, English currency, a Bank of England man as the head of our central bank, related Prime Minister Dom Mintoff, growing indignant at the memory.

title: M.B.A. Rush: That Glitter Isn't All Gold
description: THERE are 27 simply furnished interview rooms in which corporate recruiters visiting the University of Pennsylvania's prestigious Wharton School meet with its M.B.A. candidates. From the beginning of this month until the first of next April, every one of those rooms has been booked for backtoback appointments eight hours day, Monday through Friday, by the representatives of 600 companies and organizations that will vie hire Masters of Business Administration at annual salaries that ton $30,000.

title: Kennedy Backers Told To Quit Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13  The White House warned any supporters of Senator Edward M. Kennedy among the Administration's political appointees today that they ought to go somewhere else to work.

title: In Fall, the House Is a Home Again
description: RANDOM thoughts to ponder, while waiting for my daughter Katie to finish her ritual in the bathroom:

title: Five Novels
description: ROTTER, lapsed member of Gamblers Limited, cab driver, excop and almost exhusband, has spent his life betting on anything that moved. Unfortunately, it has inevitably failed to move as fast as Trotter thought it was going to. But then one day at the races, at the Horsefeathers Bar, where the Happy Hour lasts from noon to 12:45 and goldfish die from cigar smoke inhalation, Trotter and Lady Luck begin an afternoon's affair that starts this goodhumored second novel off at a gallon.

title: Splurging on a Sink: Unusual Designs
description: IF you are thinking of sprucing up your bathroom and you can afford a small splurge, replace the sink with one of the many unusual designs now on the market.

title: Buying a Home With a Partner
description: ACCUSTOMED to living in elegant surroundings for most of their married lives, neither Jane Avery nor Barbara Williamson cared for the idea of ending up alone in. a small apartment after they each got divorced six years ago.

title: The Key to Potting Plants Lies in the Soil
description: WHILE spring is usually a better time to divide and repot house plants, there is always some of it to be done in the fall. Perhaps a plant has outgrown its container during the summer, or a new division or cutting from a plant that has grown too large to be brought indoors may be starting. Whatever the reason, the choice of potting soils is important.

title: A Tax to Stabilize Wages
description: The dilemma posed to our lawmakers by inflation is easily described: without strong and effective compulsory controls, there is a serious question whether the wageprice spiral can ever be broken. Nevertheless, the idea of wageprice controls is so unpopular with Americans as to make it seem almost impossible for this approach to the problem to be adopted. Meanwhile, the countermeasures attempted by Government are largely ineffective, and inflation continues unabated.

title: This We Believe: A Nutmeg Almanac
description: NUTMEGGERS believe that: All state roads are legally closed, and are likely to remain that way.

title: TripleHeader in Newark
description: NEWARK THERE'S this little effigy of a man about 2 feet tall and dressed in a deeppurple suit with a beige turtleneck. He stands in the court of the Newark Museum, his little white hands  both of them left, for some reason  resting on a lectern.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Last Week's Tally for the Metropolitan Area

title: How to Remedy Furniture Mishaps
description: THE long winter months ahead can mean trouble for furniture, but only because it may get too much care and attention. Then comes summertime, and the problems appear.

title: Heady Headhunters
description: THEY stalk their quarries through the executive suites. Armed with business directories, 100,000name data banks, press clippings and confidential dossiers, the executivesearch concerns  management recruiters or, commonly, headhunters  are out to corral the nation's leading businessmen and professionals to fill rooms at the top. So in an age of specialization, when finding specialists is a specialty, the executivesearch business is booming.

title: City Opera's Orchestra Ratifies Pact by 62 to 6
description: The New York City Opera orchestra overwhelmingly approved a new threeyear agreement with management last night during the first intermission of the Rigoletto performance at the New York State Theater. The vote was 62 to 6.

title: Child Cancer Victim In Dispute on Laetrile Dies in Mexico Home
description: BOSTON, Oct. 13 (AP)  Chad Green, the 3yearold leukemia victim whose parents defied a court order and took him to Mexico for treatment with Laetrile, has died, his grandparents said today.

title: State Is First in School Spending
description: ALBANY, Oct. 14 (AP)  New York State continues to lead the nation in total spending for public elementary and secondary education, but is second to Alaska in per pupil expenditures, a statewide taxpayer research organization said last week.

title: Peter Deliheim of RCA Records
description: Peter Dellheim, an executive producer for RCA Red Seal Records and an expert technological recording director for many classicalmusic stars, died Saturday of cancer at New York University Hospital. He was 52 years old.

title: Detectives Press Search for Slayer In Bronx Project
description: Police detectives questioned residents of a middleincome housing project at Pelham Parkway and Bronxwood Avenue in the Bronx yesterday about the sexual assault and strangulation of a small 26yearold woman Friday morning on a staircase landing.

title: Bridge:
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 14  The American team suffered a severe setback in the 10th round of the world championship qualifying here this afternoon, losing by 34 international match points to its old rivals, the Italians. This converted into 5 to 15 in terms of victory points, and brought the Italians almost level in the standings.

title: Issue and Debate Outlook on Deploying of the Mobile Missile
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  In early September, President Carter made what many military and foreign policy officials believe was the most important decision affecting American strategic nuclear forces in a decade. He approved a Defense Department proposal to build a force of 200 mobile intercontinental missiles, known as theMX, that would be placed aboard fleet of .huge launcher vehicles designed to roam around the American Southwest.

title: Market Place
description: WE became bullish about bank stocks last May, partly because of the strong rate of earnings generation, recalled Thomas H. Hanley, a bank stock analyst at Salomon Brothers. Then, in late August, we turned cautious following the sharp runup in bank shares and we've remained cautious toward the group since that time.

title: Peking Theater Reflects a Shift From Mao Era
description: PEKING, Oct. 14  In the climactic scene of a new play being performed in a workers club here, two Communist Party secretaries responsible for an air force base are locked in an argument over China's current developmentoriented oolicies.

title: Kissed By a Gypsy, And an MG
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Sometimes think, a dear Irish lady of long acquintance once confided to me over a drop of the good stuff, that I'd forget my own head if it weren't screwed on. But I'll tell you for a fact, she added, dabbing at her eye, if I live to be a hundred, I'll never forget the night the gypsy kissed me. It took a few heavyhanded portions of the poteen to wheedle the story from her, but it was apparent that neither 40odd years nor many thousands of miles had dimmed her recollection of a summer night in Ireland when a 16yearold lass and a peripatetic tinker's lad had waited out a rainstorm under a bridge. I've only to close my eyes, she said, doing just that, and it's real enough to take my breath away. It did.

title: TV: A Barbara Gartland Romance
description: THE heroine, an American heiress, is young, untouched and very beautiful. Traveling through Paris on her way to an arranged marriage with an English duke, she is seen by the decadent and somewhat frightening marquis, who exclaims: She is a goddess. I shallnever sleep again without praying that she may sleep with me in the darkness of the night.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: JOHN R. M. C. SZOGYEN

title: 75,000 March in Capital in Drive To Support Homosexual Rights
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  An enthusiastic crowd of at least 75,000 people from around the country paraded through the capital today in a homosexual rights march and gathered afterward on the grounds of the Washington Monument to marvel at their own numbers and to urge passage of legislation to protect the rights of homosexuals.

title: Bond Delays Expected
description: Almost $1 billion of new taxexempt bonds and notes are scheduled for sale this week, an amount of financing that would be substantial at any time, but that is likely to be unmanageable now. Some major bond sales will almost certainly be postponed until the credit markets regain their composure, municipal bond dealers predicted late last week.

title: Marriage Announcement 4  No Title
description: Rose Ellen Sutterlin Bride of William Sahm, Architect

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: ALL KINDS Art works in stainless steel, glass and plastic, along with examples of the traditional bronze, wood, stone and clay mediums, make up the latest display of the Sculptors Guild, tomorrow through Nov. 2, at Lever House, Park Avenue and 53d Street. Sixty sculptors  among then Bruno Lucchesi, Roy Gussow, Anthony Padavano, Kunio Izuka and Chaim Gross  are represented in the admissionfree display of the guild, a community of professional artists organized in 1937.

title: Man and Woman Are Found Slain
description: The bodies of a 22yearold man and a 34yearold mother of three were found yesterday at the woman's ranch house in the residential community of Mahopac, N.Y. Both victims had been shot and their throats had been slashed, police sources said.

title: 9 G.O.P. Hopefuls Vie for Attention at an Iowa Dinner
description: AMES, Iowa , Oct. 14  An attempt was made to spread Presidential fever at the cavernous Iowa State University field house last nignt as nine of the 10 announced or unannounced candidates for the Republican nomination spoke at what was billed as a Cavalcade of Stars.

title: Outdoors: Films for FairWeather Sportsmen
description: WITH temperatures dipping into the 30's, the golden days of summer have fadded fast. Yet, all is not lost for the fairweather sailors and the outdoorsmen who prefer to spend the winter indoors. A growing number of outdoors films are available to fill those cold, dark nights with warm memories.

title: Bengals Win First as Steelers Help
description: Having nothing but six losses to show after their first halfdozen National Football League games this season, the Bengals had no reason for optimism as they faced the Pittsburgh Steelers, last season's Super Bowl champions, at Riverfront Stadium in Cincinnati yesterday. They could not have anticipated the generosity of the Steelers, however, who gave up seven fumbles and two pass interceptions to the Bengals as Cincinnati registered its first victory, 3410.

title: China, Taiwan in Cup Soccer
description: ZURICH, Oct. 14 (AP)  China was officially readmitted to the International Federation of Football Associations today after an absence of 21 years and was immediately placed in the same regional competition as Taiwan for the qualifying matches of the 1982 World Cup soccer finals, to be played in Spain.

title: Number of Refugees From Vietnam Is Reported Off Sharply Since June
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Oct. 19  Since July, when Vietnam undertook to stern for a time the flow of people leaving its shores in small boats without passports or visas, arrivals of these boat people throughout Southeast Asia have dwindled dramatically.

title: Workers Find Flextime Makes for Flexible Living
description: It is 3:30 P.M. on a Friday and A number of perfectly businesslike people have skipped out of the office to do A number of unbusinesslike things.

title: Stanhouse Discloses Injury
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 14  Don Stanhouse, Baltimore's No. 1 reliever, whose ineffective pitching has contributed to Pittsburgh's two World Series victories, disclosed today that he had been working with a pulled muscle in his back.

title: Typhoon Heads for Philippines
description: MANILA, Oct. 14 (UPI)  A typhoon bore down on the Philippines today with center winds of up to 144 miles an hour, prompting the weather bureau to post an alert for wide areas of the nation. The Manila weather bureau said that the typhoon, the 18th tropical storm of the year in this area, was 700 miles east of the Philippines and was expected to hit the region by Wednesday.

title: Winslow Suffers Broken Leg
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 14 (AP)  Kellen Winslow of the San Diego Chargers broke a bone in his left leg during today's National Football League game against the Seattle Seahawks and will be sidelined about six weeks, club officials said.

title: Neighbors of Mission Glad to See Castro Go
description: Kuno Laren finally began moving into his new home yesterday, a brownstone across from the Cuban Mission to the United Nations, at 38th Street and Lexington Avenue. Until the departure of President Fidel Castro of Cuba, the movers Mr. Laren hired over the phone last week had refused to do the job.

title: Kahn Pledges A Firm Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  President Carter will pursue a tight money policy over the months ahead to fight inflation even though it raises the risk of a deeper economic recession, Alfred Kahn, chairman of the President's Council on Wage and Price Stability, said today.

title: Foreigners Swell U.S. Store Sales
description: Although rising interest rates and a threatened credit crunch may affect domestic consumer purchasing, foreign travelers purchases of of American goods are surging on the opportunities afforded by a weakened dollar and the relatively lower prices here.

title: Tax Relief for Business Quietly Gaining Support
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19  In a quiet display of painstaking, longrange strategy, Washington lobbyists and tax lawyers  with encouragement from important Democrats and Republicans in Congress  have drafted a taxrelief bill for business that has a good chance of becoming law in 1980.

title: Makers of Defoliant Are Sued
description: SPRING CITY, Pa., Oct. 14 (UPI)Charles Hartz, a decorated Vietnam veteran has filed a lawsuit in Federal District Court against five chemical companies that manufactured the defoliant Agent Orange, which he says caused his terminal brain cancer.

title: Gifts for the Pontiff Ranged From Jeans to a Rare Bible
description: When Pope John Paul II returned to Rome Oct. 7, he took back a gold medal given him by Mayor Koch, a sterling silver tray from Gov. Edward J. King of Massachusetts, a gold paperweight from Mayor Jane M. Byrne of Chicago and a rare Bible, printed in 1790, that was presented to him by Mayor Frank L. Rizzo of Philadelphia.

title: Fairfield Market Luring Newspapers and Cable TV
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Oct. 12  Fairfield County, a mecca for corporate headquarters in recent years, is drawing some of the nation's largest media conglomerates to a wealthy, but fragmented, newspaper and broadcasting market that at least one newspaper executive in this area describes as ripe for plucking by someone.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Libya Seeks a Wider Oil Role
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  With its oil pro duction lagging behind targets, Libya is joining other important oil producers in moving to make more profitable and varied use of its remaining petroleum reserves, its sole significant source of foreign exchange.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: Did Chuck Essegian or Jackie Robinson or Jackie Jensen ever hit a home run in the World Series and score a touchdown in a Rose Bowl game?

title: Executives Hail Fed's New Policy
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., Oct. 13  Despite record high interest rates, upheaval in the stock markets and the prospect of a growing recession, the Federal Reserve Board's credittightening moves drew rave reviews from top corporate executives gathered here.

title: Marriage Announcement 5  No Title
description: Elisse Deborah Schlesinger Wed

title: Chess:
description: When the British Broadcasting Corporation adopted the fast time limit of 40 moves in two hours and all additional moves in one hour for its tournament, the idea was to obtain short games suitable for presentation in its series of halfhour television programs. Instead, it mostly tended toward the opposite.

title: The Riddle of the Nobel Scanner
description: The award of a Nobel Prize to the developers of the CAT scanner last week rightly recognized a revolutionary advance in medical technology. It should also revive concern over whether the United States is using such new machines wisely.

title: LAND ISSUE AT HEART OF RHODESIA IMPASSE
description: LONDON, Oct. 14  Years ago, when the white men first came to our country, they took all the best land for themselves, Joshua Nkomo said the other day, his voice heavy with feeling. They removed the African people to areas where there was no water, where the soil was poor, where life was hard. Now the dispossessed want their good land back. It's as simple as that.

title: Dancing and Singing Mark Emotional Gathering as Jews Celebrate Simhath Torah
description: A deafening chant of rhythmic songs echoed in a Brooklyn synagogue yesterday as chain after chain of bearded men in dark suits, grasping each other by the arms and shoulders, danced in lines through the packed congregation.

title: Rock: Knack's Power Pop
description: ROCKANDROLL can be divided into the kind that symbolizes societal rebellion and the kind that contents itself with a happy, energetic good time. The current fad for power pop is a classic example of the funrock category. Born of the passionate rebellion ofpunk rock, power pop strips away the rebellion yet infuses mainstream rock with a fresh, welcome vitality.

title: Shells Kill 5 in Thai Refugee Camp
description: ARANYAPRATHET, Thailand, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  Five Cambodians were killed when a refugee camp in Thailand was shelled today as fighting between the two warring sides in Cambodia raged near the border.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: It's All in Black And White
description: JOHANNESBURG A South African on the plane from New York pointed down to great mounds of barren earth. Those are mining dumps, he said. Since the price of gold went uo. they are rerefinine the old dumpings.

title: Westway's Fate Is Still Uncertain After Eight Years of Controversy
description: Almost eight years after the establishment of the West Side Highway Project in New York City, the proposed 4.2mile, sunken sixlane highway designed to spur renewal from the Battery to 42d Street is still the focus of a controversy that may prevent its ever being built.

title: Miss Navratilova Downs Mrs. Lloyd
description: PHOENIX, Oct. 19 (AP)  Topseeded Martina Navratilova, playing an aggressive serveandvolley game, needed only 56 minutes to beat Chris Evert Lloyd, 61, 64, today and repeat as the victor in the $100,000 Phoenix Classic.

title: Moscow Urges West Europeans To Reject New American Missile
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  The Kremlin called on the people of Western Europe today to resist plans to station new United States mediumrange missiles there aimed at the Soviet Union.

title: 15 Rockhill Native Upset by $72 Victor
description: Joanie's Chief, last out of the gate but first across the finish line, dealt a blow to Rockhill Native's 2yearold coltoftheyear hopes by winning the $136,250 Champagne Stakes at Belmont yesterday.

title: Events Today
description: THE MARRIAGE OF MARIA BRAUN, directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder lin German with English subtitles); at the Cinema Studio I Cinema at Broadway and 66th Street.

title: Dance: Taiwanese Debut
description: THE New York debut of the Cloud Gate Dance Theater of Taiwan, at Brooklyn College's Whitman Hall Saturday night, made for a highly interesting evening and one that should have attracted more dance figures than it did in an otherwise full house.

title: Fiori Takes Playoff, Defeating Weiskopf
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., Oct. 19 (AP)  Ed Fiori calmly knocked in a birdie putt on the second playoff hole today to defeat Torn Weiskopf and capture the $200,000 Southern open golf tournament.

title: Shuler Gains in Garden Boxing
description: Jimmy Shuler's mother did not see him win his quarterfinal fight in the 156pound division of the World Cup boxing tournament at Felt Forum last night. This is not unusual, inasmuch as she always remains in the ladies room during his fights. This time she remained in Philadelphia and suffered in absentia. He was not at a loss for parental guidance, however.

title: Brazil Devalues Cruzeiro
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct 14 (Reuters)  Brazil devalued its currency against the dollar by almost 2 percent on Friday, the 14th downward adjustment this year. The Central Bank of Brazil set a new rate of 30.345 cruzeiros to the dollar.

title: Opera: Street Scene
description: KURT WEILL'S Street Scene might well have been written to take advantage of the City Opera's traditional strength as a performing ensemble. The work certainly brought out the very best in the company at last spring's revival, and on Saturday afternoon Street Scene made a welcome return to the repertory with substantially the same cast.

title: Mother Guilty in Child Killings
description: SEATTLE, Oct. 14 (AP)  Tanya Adams, the 25yearold mother accused of killing her two young sons by throwing them off a bridge into the icy Columbia River, was found guilty on two counts of firstdegree murder late yesterday and faces up to two life sentences in prison.

title: An Amnesty for Drinkers
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  The authorities in the south Indian state of Tamil Nadu, where alcohol is banned, have declared an amnesty for 1,500 people imprisoned for drinking and have withdrawn court cases against 51,000 others. But the Chief Minister, M. G. Ramachandran, said yesterday in Madras, the state capital, that the government would not reverse its policy of total prohibition.

title: Coach's Confidence Gives Gray Needed Lift
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. Oct. 14  When Earnest Gray dropped a pass from Phil Simms early in the second quarter, it looked as if it was going to be another one of those bad days for the rookie receiver.

title: Balloons, Bands, Exotic Foods Spice a Street Fair in Brooklyn
description: Great white balloons, a yard in diameter and painted by professional artists from the community, marked an 11block aerial pattern along Brooklyn's Atlantic Avenue yesterday, bouncing and nodding above the music, movement and mellow mood of the fifth annual Atlantic Antic street fair.

title: ABROAD AT HOME More Than They Deserve
description: BOSTON, Oct. 14  In the 1930's and 1940's many of the world's leaders stood by, mute, as a human disaster took place. History has not forgotten. New books continue to record the terrible facts of their indifference.

title: Caps, Maruk Beat Rangers
description: If Don Murdoch would have been the referee last night at Madison Square Garden, the New York Rangers would have had at least a tie in their home opener against the Washington Capitals instead of a 53 loss. But Denis Morel was the referee and the puckMurdoch saw go into the goal off his stick, Morel saw go in off Murdoch's skate. All it was worth was an argument, which Murdoch did not win.

title: Series Managers: Contrast of Styles
description: PITTSBURGH LOGIC, Earl Weaver says, is in the eyes of the beholder. Being the only beholder who counts, Weaver sees everything he does with his Baltimore Orioles  whether it is selecting his team, making out the day's lineup or making moves during a game  as perfectly logical.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM. Sonata in D for Oboe and Continuo, Besozzi; Parthia, Krumlovsky; Romance and Prelude, Rachmaninoff.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: City Opera: First `Rigoletto
description: SATURDAY night's performance of Rigoletto at the New York City Opera, the first of the season, was a dispirited affair. Presumably, the company's recent suspension of activity reduced the usual allotment of rehearsal time. Inany case, the orchestra, under Brian Salesky, played listlessly, coordination between stage and pit was often tentative, and the choral singing was suprisingly unkempt.

title: 1,000 at Dinner Honor Iakovos For Leadership
description: Led by an array of government, academic and religious leaders, more than 1,000 people gathered at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel last night for a blacktie dinner honoring Archbishop Iakovos and celebrating the 20th anniversary of his enthronement as the spiritual leader of the Greek Orthodox Church in North and South America.

title: Tonight Jets Get to Say,`Hi, Mom! From New York
description: WHY doesn't anyone ever say Hi, Dad! when the camera catches a player on Monday Night Football? The Jets coach, Walt Michaels, wonders about that.

title: Stars Shine in Savings Ads
description: LOS ANGELES, Oct. 14  The ad war among California savings and loan associations has begun to look like the late movie on television.

title: ECEVIT PARTY LOSES MAJORITY IN TURKEY AS RIGHT WING GAINS
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Oct. 14  Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit's leftofcenter Government conceded defeat tonight to the rightwing Justice Party in parliamentary byelections, opening the way to a new Government crisis.

title: Pianist: Bella Davidovich
description: BELLA DAVIDOVICH'S American recital debut Friday night at Carnegie Hall was one of those periodic events in New York musical life that generate their own excitement. Nearly everyone in this city's concert and pianistic circles seemed to want to hear this unassuming yet sweetly poeticlooking woman who had been one of the Soviet Union's admired musicians for 20 years before she emigrated a year ago and settled in Queens.

title: Cadets Resist Honor Case Reversal
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Oct. 11  It was just before the Christmas recess last year, and Cadet Moses G. Davis, a sophomore at the United States Military Academy, was chatting with a plebe, or freshman, woman in their barracks. She was sitting in her room; he was standing in the doorway.

title: 2 Black Leaders Seeking to Avert Rift on Mideast
description: Turning aside criticism of contacts between American blacks and the Palestine Liberation Organization, two national civil rights leaders said yesterday that Americans should not be encouraged to choose between Arabs and Jews in taking positions on the Middle East.

title: Texas Group Helps Find Schools For the Children of Illegal Aliens
description: DALLAS, Oct. 14  The Rev. Francis X. Fernandez, pastor of Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church here, spent much of last week trying to find a way to provide a free education for 3,000 to 5,000 children who can no longer attend the public schools here.

title: Will New York Become a RodgersShorter Showdown?
description: THEY are the symbols of their sport, the Palmer and Nicklaus of running, whose class and character set them apart. And when Frank Shorter and Bill Rodgers leave the starting line in the front row for the New York City Marathon next Sunday morning, their lives again will be intertwined as they have been since 1966.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Archibald B. Roosevelt, a Son of Theodore, Dies at 85
description: Archibald Bulloch Roosevelt, the last surviving son of President Theodore Roosevelt, and in his own right a decorated soldier, a Wall Street figure and a leading conservationist, died Saturday of complications after a stroke at his home in Hobe Sound, Fla. He was 85 years old.

title: Around the Nation
description: PLATTEVILLE, Colo., Oct. 14 (AP) The Fort St. Vrain nuclear power plant was shut down today when a tiny amount of radiation escaped from a helium relief valve inside the reactor building.

title: The City
description: An offduty policeman was charged with firstdegree assault and another placed on modified duty following a shooting in a New Dorp, S.I., bar that left a patron critically wounded in the head.

title: 100,000 Flock to Bonn In Atom Power Protest
description: BONN, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  Up to 100,000 demonstrators marched through central Bonn today demanding that atomic power plants in West Germany be closed.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: `True Hell in Cambodia
description: Because he spoke English he had worked in a Cambodian tourist hotel and for Americans during the Lon Nol regime. Earlier, he had worked for the British crew filming Lord Jim. Conrad's Marlowe used say of Lord Jim that he was one of us, and the Cambodian named Dith Pran is surely one of us. He served as a reporter for The New York Times in Phnom Penh,and he stuck it out when the city fell to the Khmer Rouge in 1975; he wanted to finish his story. He is also one of us in a wider sense. The tale of suffering that one man brings from a sealed and collapsing society is a burden on all human beings.

title: CARTER'S PLURALITY ASSURED IN FLORIDA
description: MIAMI, Monday, Oct. 15  After a protracted, disputed count of ballots in nearby Palm Beach early today, President Carter's reelection campaign won a plurality in Florida's statewide Democratic caucuses over a challenge mounted here by partisans of Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts.

title: Weekly Lotto Numbers Drawn
description: The numbers picked Saturday night in New York State's weekly Lotto drawing were 7, 24, 33, 3, 22 and 26. The supplementary number was 2.

title: City Bar Panel Proposes Requiring Some Free Work by Every Lawyer
description: A committee of the New York City Bar Association has recommended the adoption of a new professional rule  the first of its kind anywhere in the countrythat would require each of the city's 45,000 lawyers to donate 30 to 50 hours a year in free or lowcost legal service to needy individuals or public causes.

title: De Gustibus Memories of Sand Crabs
description: I was a bit surprised a short while ago when someone inquired as to whether the tiny sand crabs you find on many beaches are edible. Two recipes (untried, it must be confessed) were offered, more as a matter of novelty and record than anything else.

title: Opera: Chicago Marks Lyric's Silver Jubilee
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 14  Chicago had a gala concert this afternoon. When four of the world's greatest tenors  Luciano Pavarotti, Carlo Cossutta, Alfredo Kraus and Jon Vickers  share a single stage, the event could indeed legitimately be called a gala. And when such matineeidols of the operatic world are joined by such superstars as Mirella Freni, Nicolai Ghiaurov, Sherrill Milnes, Margaret Price and Leontyne Price, the afternoon could perhaps be called a supergala, with some added glamour in the presence of Princess Margaret of Britain, who happens to be touring America on behalf of the Royal Opera Covent Garden Development Appeal.

title: Menuhin in Plea to Europeans
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Oct. 14 (Reuters)  Yehudi Menuhin appealed to Europeans today to set an example for peace after he was awarded a peace prize at the Frankfurt Book Fair. Accepting the $14,000 prize, the 63yearold violinist said that only Europe could give an example of inner and outer peace, which seems so hopelessly elusive.

title: 2 Failed Banks Taken Over
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14 (AP)  Two banks  one in New Jersey and the other in Texas  failed last week, but both were quickly taken over by other institutions, the Government said.

title: XRay Scanners Plague E. M I s Financial Health
description: LONDON, Oct. 14  Godfrey N. Hounsfield, the corporate scientist named last week as a winner of the Nobel Prize for physiology, had some explaining to do in his hour of triumph.

title: Simms and Gray Pace Giants 3216 Victory
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Oct. 14  In only his second National Football League start, Phil Simms passed for 300 yards today and as a result the Giants have a winning streak. They beat the San Francisco 49ers, 3216, in a veritable feast of offensive milestones for 70.352 fans at Giants Stadium thatfeatured the passing of the firstround draft choice to the secondround draft choice, Earnest Gray.

title: Sporting Gear
description: To practice catching a football has always required at least two participants. But with the Spiral Passer, a football passing machine made by the Fonas Corporation of Latrobe, Pa., anyone can load a special football into the machine, set the timer, race out on a pass pattern and then try for a perfectly tossed ball that can travel up to almost 20 yards. The ball, which is included in the set, is made of soft plastic with a hole at each end to let it slide down the tube that guides it. Stretched latexrubber tubes, protected by parallel steel bars, give the ball the impetus for a trajectory of 12 to 14 feet. The set is sold for under $30 at ToysRUs and Two Guys stores.

title: Clippers Top Sonics As Free Scores 35
description: SAN DIEGO, Oct. 14 (AP)  Lloyd Free poured in 35 points tonight to lead the San Diego Clippers to a 9893 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Stuart Fleischer, Accountant, Marries Carole L. Solomon

title: Sports World Specials
description: Sid Sportsfan, the fellow who works weekdays from 9 to 5, had a tough weekend. He battled his way through the only Friday, Saturday and Sunday of the year in which the four major sports were all on display and he drank deeply from his overflowing cup.

title: Whither Random House?; Prospective Buyers Figure Called Overpriced
description: FRANKFURT, Oct. 14  In the corridors of the International Book Fair here as in the canyons of Wall Street, publishers posed the same hard question: Who is going to buy Random House?

title: Marriage Announcement 2  No Title
description: A.G. Loucas Weds Sandra Lehmann

title: River Panel Says Delaware Needs Some New Dams
description: TRENTON, Oct. 14  New dams and reservoirs costing hundreds of millions of dollars are needed to assure an orderly and adequate supply of water for New York City and parts of New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware in times of severe drought, according to officials of an interstate commission that controls the water of the Delaware River.

title: A Big Baby Dedicated
description: Notes on People

title: Booming Texas Outgrows Frontier Image
description: HOUSTON, Oct. 14  Three hundred miles and at least two eras from this bubbling metropolis, at a deserted crossroads in the hard, flat aridity of West Texas where cowboys once fought Comanches, there stands a historical marker. It tells of the life and death of the town of Anarene. Founded on cattle in 1908,raised to a quick zenith by the early oilmen, the town was extinct by 1960. Not a building or a shack remains. Just a barbedwire fence, the lonesome wind sighing through the grass and mesquite, and ghosts.

title: Television in West Germany Becomes Hot Political Issue
description: BONN, Oct. 14  On a West German primetime television show last week, two women, each holding a length of rope thick enough to hold fast the Queen Mary, raced against the clock to lace up a giant hiking shoe. The audience howled, the contestants perspired and the master of ceremonies, an unctuous blend of winks and nudges, waved his cue cards in exultation.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: MONDAY, OCTOBER 15, 1979

title: In Paris, High Fashion's Latest Trip Is to Outer Space
description: PARIS, Oct. 14  The place: a barren landscape, somewhere on the moon or beyond. The time: sometime after World War III. The air is filled with electronic beeps and rhythmic percussion sounds. The inhabitants, a stately bunch, glide about as if in a trance, eyes forward, carrying their helmets and towering headdresses with an unearthly ease, as if they had overdosed on, perhaps, fashion.

title: Rogers 1Up Victor For MatchPlay Title
description: WENTWORTH, England, Oct. 14 (AP)  Bill Rogers shook off his bridesmaid complex today and edged the defender, Isao Aoki of Japan, 1 up, after 36 holes of fiercely competitive golf and won the World Match Play championship.

title: Castro Abruptly Leaves City Under Tight Security
description: President Fidel Castro of Cuba left the United States early yesterday morning as he had come, with little prior notice and under the cover of darkness.

title: Unannounced Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  Something even more confusing than the Florida delegate elections is going on in American Presidential politics: the unannounced candidate masquerade.

title: The Editorial Notebook M.P.G. Is Worth the Risk
description: Harbridge House, a respected consulting firm specializing in the auto industry, has seen the future  and is pretty sure it won't work. What worries Harbridge is the increasing financial strain that the Government's fuel economy standards for 1985 will place on American manufacturers. Ina report commissioned by General Motors, the consultants advise rethinking the commitment to mandatory fuel economy.

title: Commodities
description: AWEEK after the Federal Reserve Board again took up arms against inflation, it could claim some victories, albeit modest ones, over the rising prices of most basic commodities. Faced with a severe tightening of credit and the promise of a deep recession, copper tumbled last week, along with prices of financial instrument futures, coffee and cocoa.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: Deaths

title: SCHMIDT BIDS WEST ACCEPT SOVIET OFFER
description: BONN, Oct. 14  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said today that the stated willingness of Leonid I. Brezhnev to open talks on European security could mean that new American mediumrange nuclear missiles might never have to be deployed in Western Europe.

title: Washington Watch
description: WASHINGTON PFESIDENT CARTER'S commission on the accident at Three Mile Island is due to deliver its report to the President by the end of this month, and it may have an important effect on the future of the nuclear power industry in the United States.

title: Brown Ends First Full Week of a National Tour With Mixed Results
description: Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. of California finished his first full week of campaigning yesterday with mixed results in his struggle for identity as a Democratic alternative to President Carter and Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts.

title: The Real Pirates Stand Up and Win
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 14  At last, we know how the Pittsburgh Pirates came within one game of losing the World Series.

title: Seoul Lifts Ban on Times Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  State Department officials said today that the South Korean Government had reconsidered its ban on the entry of Richard Halloran of The New York Times and would allow him to report on the visit to Seoul this week by Secretary of Defense Harold Brown.

title: Advertising
description: AIRLINE deregulation and the pricecutting that followed have not only revitalized commercial air travel, but also caused quite a stir among the rentacar crowd, which is finding that the moneyconscious leisuretime traveler has suddenly become a marketing target to reckon with. That has led to alterations in both the message and medium of carrental advertising, which previously had been aimed primarily at the business traveler.

title: The Region
description: WEEHAWKEN, N.J. (UPI)  Conrail freight traffic returned to normal after 10 cars that derailed in a tunnel under the Palisades were placed back on the tracks and officials found no leaks from a shipment of lowlevel radioactive material.

title: A Photographer Is Struck
description: PARIS, Oct 14 Guy Marineau, a freelance photographer working for German Vogue, was struck by a security guard today, as he attempted to enter one of the tents in which the French fashion shows are held.

title: WomeninBusiness Week Events Expected to Draw 10,000 in City
description: More than 10,000 New York metropolitan area women are expected to take part this week in workshops, luncheons, seminars and other presentations sponsored by 25 of New York City's corporations as part of WomeninBusiness Week.

title: Canada's Liberals Meet, and Don't Invite Trudeau
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Oct. 14About 200 members of the oncepowerful Liberal Party, apparently still shocked by the Liberal defeats of last May, ended a meeting here today with indications that an attempt will be made to depose Pierre Elliott Trudeau as head of the party.

title: Bergland Sees High Loan Rates Forcing Price of Farms Lower
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  Sharply increased interest rates will soon reduce the price of farm land, and they could inhibit some largescale cattlefeeding operations, according to Bob Bergland, the Secretary of Agriculture.

title: U.S. Says Soviet Plans to Increase Warheads Aimed at West Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 14  The Soviet Union will increase the number of tactical nuclear warheads aimed at Western Europe from about 2,100 today to 3,250 by 1985, according to projections disclosed by the Defense Department.

title: ESSAY John Connally And Israel
description: WASHINGTON  For the first time, a candidate for President has delivered a major address which he knew would disturb and dismay every American supporter of Israel.

title: CHINESE AND INDIANS SLOWLY EXPAND TIES
description: NEW DELHI, Oct. 12  Five prominent Chinese journalists are touring India on the first such visit in 18 years. Last week an Indian politician returned from a visit to China and urged that regular air links be established between the two countries. And discussions are under way on the exchange of permanently assigned news correspondents in Peking and New Delhi.

title: Ford Says Charges Against Pinto Are Rehash of 1977 Allegations
description: DETROIT, Oct. 14 (UPI)  The Ford Motor Company said today that a newspaper report accusing the company of knowingly producing Pintos susceptible to fiery rearend crashes were a rehash of charges first published two years ago.

title: HIIA LEAVES PEKING FOR EUROPEAN TOUR
description: PEKING, Oct. 14  Hua Guofeng, China's Communist Party chairman and Prime Minister, lands in Paris tomorrow on the first leg of a visit to France, West Germany, Britain and Italy, the first time in history that a Chinese head of state has gone so far west.

title: Carter, Revisiting Chicago Today, Isn't About to Repeat 78 Blunder
description: CHICAGO, Oct. 13  Not quite a year and a half ago, President Carter fell into disfavor among his party's regulars here after the White House showed something less than alacrity in responding to an invitation to address the annual fundraising dinner of the Cook County Democratic Central Committee.

title: Toon, Leaving Moscow, Assails U.S. Reliance on Dobrynin Role
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 14  Ambassador Malcolm Toon, closing out his diplomatic career on Tuesday, says the Carter Administration has relied too much on the Soviet Embassy in Washington to get American views across to the Kremlin and not enough on its own professional staff here.

title: Kush Dismissal Jolts Arizona State
description: Frank Kush was dismissed, at least temporarily, as head football coach at Arizona State University Saturday, midway through his 22d season in the job and midway through the trial of a $1 million damage suit brought against him and the university by one of his former players.

title: Soviet Scientists See Potential Nuclear Power Problems
description: MOSCOW, Oct. 14  Possibly for the first time in the official press, two authoritative Soviet scientists have warned that Government plans to satisfy the Soviet Union's growing energy needs with nuclear power could create serious ecological and safety problems.

title: Updating the Parties Membership Practices
description: WASHINGTON  American political parties are in trouble. They've been in trouble for years. And everyone overlooks an obvious cause.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, Oct. 14 (UPI)  Negotiations to save The Times of London adjourned tonight after nine hours of discussion. Both sides expressed guarded optimism but declined to make any detailed comment on the talks.

title: Marriage Announcement 3 -- No Title
description: Rita Llop Married To Joseph Cohen

title: Theater: Vonnegut's Rosewater As a Musical
description: I'M not quite sure that I've ever heard an overture have a nervous breakdown before. But the overture at the Entermedia, where a musical version of Kurt Vonnegut's God Bless You, Mr. Rosewater has just opened, is having one. There themusicians are, playing along in stately fashion until a banjo seems to predominate, slightly. Then the piano loses control of its pulse, a race to see which instrumentalist can develop the highest blood pressure begins, the whole thing degenerates into the quick hysteria of silentmovie hurry music, and just when you suppose them exhausted  the musicians recover for a mighty expansion into Handellike ecstasy. Very spiritual, finally. And very funny.

title: A Long Evening's Journey Into a Past
description: IT was a fine evening, rich in resonance and emotion: an evening at the Public Theater dedicated to celebrating the birthday of America's only playwright to win a Nobel Prize  Eugene O'Neill, who would have been 91 years old tomorrow. And for a man whose work indelibly shaped American theater, last night's festivities were appropriate indeed  a staged reading of O'Neill and Carlotta, about the playwright and his wife, written for the occasion by Barbara Gelb and performed by

title: Pirates Win, 71, and Send Series Into 6th Game
description: PITTSBURGH, Oct. 14  One game from fading into winter early, the Pittsburgh Pirates rallied in the late innings today to defeat the Baltimore Orioles, 71, and keep the 76th World Series alive.

title: Dollar Stronger in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Monday, Oct. 15 (AP)  The dollar opened at its highest level of the year in Tokyo trading today at 228 yen, up more than 2 yen from Friday's close of 225.90 yen. Traders said early trading was quiet, with the dollar edging up to 228.20.

title: LEGAL ISSUES REMAIN IN CHAD GREEN CASE
description: BOSTON, Oct. 19 (AP)  Chad Green, a leukemia victim, died Friday evening at the age of 3 years, but the legal ramifications of his parents fight to treat him with laetrile are still to be settled.

title: ISRAELIS TO EXPAND SEVEN SETTLEMENTS ON THE WEST BANK
description: JERUSALEM, Oct. 19  Israel's Cabinet voted unanimously today to expand seven Jewish settlements on the occupied West Bank but decided to do so without seizing any privately owned Arab land. Instead, 1,125 acres in the state's possession, most of it in the hands of the Jordanian Government until the 1967 war, are to be used.

title: Broncos Deflate Young Chiefs, 2410
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 14  The Denver Broncos brought the Chiefs, who had been flying high, down to the Missouri plains with a thud here today at Arrowhead Stadium before a crowd of 74,292 that had been stimulated by Kansas City's threegame winning streak. The Broncos defeated the young Chiefs in a onesided game, 2410.

title: Escapee From Rikers Killed After 15Mile Chase on L.I.
description: Fleeing in a stolen truck driven by a hostage at gunpoint, the last of eight inmates who escaped from the Rikers Island jail last month was slain at a roadblock in Merrick, L.I., yesterday after a wild 15mile chase through Suffolk and Nassau Counties by dozens of police cars with wailing sirens.

title: Your Mother Died at 7:40
description: PITTSBURGH HIS mother had suffered a stroke about two weeks ago. Soon after that she had entered the hospital in nearby Greenville, and in the last few days her strength had begun to slip away. Yesterday morning Chuck Tanner, the manager of the Pittsburgh Pirates, arrived at Three Rivers Stadium for the fifth game of the World Series, but, concerned about his mother's condition, he phoned the hosoital.

title: German Businessman Is Killed in Teheran; British Warn Nationals
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Oct. 14 (Reuters) A West German businessman was shot to death today by unidentified gunmen and the British Embassy warned its nationals to be on guard against similar attacks. It was the first assassination of a foreigner since the February revolution.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, OCTOBER 15, 1979

title: CREDIT MARKETS Continued Rate Rise Expected
